name: Jim Cole
text: This afternoon was the first time we have eaten chicken from this KFC. We ordered chicken fingers, sides and spicy chicken wings at the drive-thru. When we got home and opened up the spicy wings they were absolutely the greasiest and most overcooked wings ever. Everyone agreed they were terribly greasy and overcooked. The rest of the food was fair. I went back to the manager and showed him the wings. To his credit he immediately recognized the greasy wings. He was very nice and refunded the $11 for the 12 wings. I am sad to say that I don't believe this business will stay open. I hope I'm wrong.

name: Sharon Gould
text: Ordered the $30 fill up which was terrible. Received 8 pieces of dark meat. No white meat at all. When I called to check was told should have 4 pieces of white meat. Told I could come back for a free meal but was home and did not want to go back.

text: Great food, friendly people working there.

name: Candice Marie
text:
#1 Chicken was cold
#2 Mashed potatoes had a clump of chesse in it.... Didn't order that 🤔
#3 Gravy looked like muddy water
#4 Had to pull up and wait on this mess 😠          Disappointed 😞

name: Gayle McPherson
text: Got dinner tonight when I got home found I had been shorted 1 chicken nugget and 1 potatoes wedge.  Poor service.

name: Amber Miller
text: I always have problems with getting my biscuits here. Only The most important part right? Lol. Really though, kind of disturbed after our latest visit. One Employee was rather sarcastic and rushing when my child didn't know what to order. She doesn't really understand the difference in the types/cuts of meat etc. I would suggest a little more training for a few of the employees as they are lacking any real customer service skills. Mainly suggesting they should be willing to help or explain things to anyone with any questions or needing assistance. Also just a quick TY to the team member that advised the other they should reconsider being so disrespectful to other people, especially their children. That's very important. Anyhow, moving on to the food.  I believe it is acceptable and comes with a variety of side items available normally, but also on few occasions items may be too cool when picking up your order. Overall, we'd rate a generous 3 stars. As always, this could change with only minor improvements as mentioned above.🤗

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text: We ordered for Mercedes, they were nice and had everything ready on time (10:15-10:20am). However, as I was only the person picking it up and not eating it, I was informed later that they had left out ALL the biscuits and since this was a large order, it made me feel bad because I did not know what to look for throughout the order and I was informed that this was a constant that had happened before (biscuits being left out, had I known, I would've searched). So I hate to give you all three stars but for that reason I am.

name: Wendy Worsley
text: Service was good but the quality of the food needs some attention.  The chicken leg looks more like a pegion leg and it was either cooked to long or been sitting out for a while.

name: Misty Wells
text: We ordered a meal with 8 pieces of extra crispy chicken...only to get home and find that they only put 7 pieces in the bucket. Chicken was soggy and not crispy at all. Just overall horrible looking chicken. Went back to get it redone and fixed; only to be told they had run out of chicken breasts...at 1 in the afternoon. Not to mention they have no sense of urgency getting orders out. Horrible!

name: Diana Gonzalez
text: Lost my business. Thanks to past reviewers I will chose a different place to eat. I don’t support businesses that are terribly manage. The fact that no one in KFC has responded to all these reviews and that ppl keep complaining about service and quality shows they don’t care for the customer which is the reason they the worker are able to pay their bills. Pass.

name: Big Diesel
text: If you're driving anything larger than a SUV this is not the place to stop for a meal. What is the point of being connected to a truck stop when people can't even place a to-go order. This KFC is Not trucker nor charter bus friendly.

name: Morgan Doerhoff
text: Was here an hour after they opened and sat in the drive through for ten minutes without anyone coming on the speaker. Pulled around to see if they were open and could see ovens on etc but nobody in sight. Watched another person drive through as well as went through a second time to see if I maybe missed the sensor. Clearly opened but no employees in sight. When I pull around the second time I see an employee in the first window but as soon as she sees me she disappears. Worst customer service I have seen.

name: Lissa D
text: Food was hot and fresh.

name: Andy Bowden
text: I have been to this location on three separate occasions in three different weeks. They never have anything cooked and ready.

name: Kelly Bice
text: I got a two piece chicken and it hard give me wrong drink very rude and no cookie and wrong side item not waist my time again or money

name: Abu Anas
text: Bad customer service

name: M.T Matthews
text: Food was disgusting. Hard biscuit... hard chicken with no taste...waste of money. Definitely won’t be going back

name: mj c
text: Great food, staff and service!!!!!!

name: Cameron Sears
text: Yesterday me and my best friend arrived at Louie’s around 12:00, the restaurant was filled with smoke. We walked to the counter and was waited on, gave our order to the lady at the counter, received our cups for our drink (everything was out except Diet Dr. pepper and Sprite). We sat down and after about 30 minutes of waiting the lady that took our order came out and told us that she appreciated our patience and informed us that our food should be out shortly, another 10 to 15 minutes went by and my best friend went to the counter only to realize that there was 1 person in the kitchen (we’re talking about lunch hour after church on a Sunday) so then he sits down and we eventually receive our food, there was multiple other upset customers in the restaurant. The food was fresh and good but took about an hour to receive it. My order was messed up but quickly fixed. So no hard feelings on the food. But at the end of the day what normally is a 15 minute trip to Louie’s took over an hour and a half. Very disappointed. Google makes me leave 1 star but if it would let me leave a Zero star review then that’s what I would rate this experience as.

name: Dick Iler
text: southern cooking at its best .. Catfish fingers

name: EastAlabamaMedia
text: The food is always great,  and the service is terrific.  Love eating there when I'm in the area.

name: Rodney Dwyer
text: Great chicken fingers. Unique dipping sauce, and crinkle fries. Reasonable price, and they share clean restrooms with the store next door. A good stop on a country drive.

name: James Price
text: Great place to stop and eat. Lunch specials are really good. Get in get your food. Friendly staff.

name: Jimmy Edwards
text: Best chicken fingers anywhere. Love the variety of food too. Nice people.

name: Joseph May
text: Great lunch prices food ain't too bad either service could use a little work at lunch time

name: Chris
text: I eat Louies multiple times a week and up until the last 2 times it had been pretty good. The last 2 nights I have had terrible experiences with new staff. The orders are taking nearly twice as long and the food isn't even half as good. Usually their veggie plates are worth the price but last night mine was terrible. Everything on the player was cold. The portions were ridiculous and they are usually great. I also got a chicken fingers plate that had 2 balled up masses of chicken that were supposed to be fingers and the wings were sooo small that they looked like blue Jay wings. Tonight my burger will be shared with my dog because I'm not eating this mess on a bun. I will eat the 6 dollar plus cheese sucks that they tried to send me home without marinara. 13.16 more for a sub part meal and a drop in service. All these restaurantsites around the lake always change staff. Just like Lake Martin pizza your service slips and you make an inferior product.

text: Clean, friendly,  good food.

name: Justin Osborne

text: This place is located inside the Pittsview Corner Mart, and the chicken is pretty dang good. At lunch, the place smells like chicken fried heaven. Lots of choices and some great sides.

text: Went by and jus happened to be day they opened. Was only serving friends and family. So I wasn't  allowed to eat there as was general public. Poor way to begin.

name: Susan Millican
text: Was trying to place an order in  the drive thru when it began pouring rain. With no awning over the speaker I pulled forward. When I tried to complete my order the cashier informed me I couldn't add anything at the window. I've worked fast food for 15 years and worked my way up to Assistant manager. I've never heard anything more ridiculous. 3 cars in the parking lot and none in the drive thru behind us so we weren't holding up the line. You just lost almost a $50 order  and I won't be back. Rude beyond belief!!!!!

name: kenny watts
text: I got 20 wings for $17 and I'm glad I did cause the wings were small. I mean 2" flats and no meat on them or the drums. I will admit, the sauce was by far some of the best sauce I have had. I got the medium, was actually medium and not to hot or mild. And a great flavor too. It took 17 of them to fill me up and I'm a 12 wing guy if they are normal size. All in all, I would definitely recommend the wings but if your like me get the 20, or smaller but with a side. I heard there spicy bbq is good too. I'll try that next.

name: Paige Divins
text: Fries were bleh. Even if the fries were super fresh when I ate them they still would have been bleh. They didn't have any color to them and lacked salt or any type of seasoning at all. The chicken strips had like some burnt crispy bits stuck to it like maybe the grease was really dirty. They do not have the good ranch, but they do have that good Honey Mustard.

name: Albert Wapples
text: Fair prices, but you get what you pay for. The fries didn't have any seasoning and the wings were small. The wings were the size of a pinky. Also idk if the cashier was rude or just honestly couldn't hear me threw the face mask.

text: My fam and I love the wings and fries here. We've tried nearly every flavor. My recent visit was about a week ago. I ordered our usual 50 piece and fries and noticed that the price had gone up a substantial amount. I thought the cashier made an error but I was told prices had changed. I was not informed of the changes when I called my order in nor did I notice any signs indicating changes. Wings get a 5 but the business itself get a 2. I'm not sure if I'll be back anytime soon. Prices are too ridiculous for me.

name: Jayy Elijah
text:
*FIRST TIME CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE*

I ordered my food via DoorDash and I called to let the company know my order wasn’t prepare correctly. The cashier that answered the phone was rude and very inconsiderate. I spent almost 30 dollars with this company. my chicken wings were over cooked and my egg rolls were burnt. The cashier let me know the egg rolls come frozen and it’s nothing they can do about them. Additionally, she told me there is a no refund policy so me even calling to complain about my order was pointless. Her exact words were “there’s nothing I can do for you.”  I will never shop with this restaurant again.

text: Came in to order & asked for a large drink with my food. Waited for my food and when I asked for my drink I was told that she forgot to ring the drink up (which I wouldn’t know since the receipts have no info on them). No problem.. I ordered the large drink again and my Paymemt was refused because it wasn’t 2 dollars and I wanted to use a card. I understand it cost money to run CC transaction that are less than a certain amount but I think since the cashier admitted to forgetting to ring up my drink an exception could have been made I had just spent 25 dollars on wings. 😤

name: Greg Hardy
text: This place is a hidden gem.  I was craving buffalo wings and luckily stumbled into Dixie wings.  My family came in and took a few minutes to decide, but we decided on 30 mild wings, 10 teriyaki wings, and a medium French fries.  The total came up to around $30, which seemed really cheap for the amount of food.  I drive it home and it took all of my will power to not eat it in the car.  I got home and destroyed the food, it was amazing.  I will visit the place many more times, check it out!

They only gave one Ranch Sauce with my order of 10 wings but with the size of the wings, I had plenty left over for the Zalad I got at Zaxby's.....
Overall, I'm not satisfied and won't be coming back.

I waited in the drive-throw for one 7 minutes and no came across the speaker to take my order. I ask the employees standing outside if they were open in which they said yes. Another few minutes went by and still no answer so we left. Hands down the worse service ever. No one seemed to want to work. No manager that I saw property managing their employees to work. My visit to Whataburger was awful and a huge was of my time. I WILL be telling everyone to avoid wasting their time going to eat there.

text: I have never before seen or heard of a chick fill a until I visited sylacauga Alabama. I want to say a special thank you to Micah the franchise owner of this store. I always like to try something new and I would recommend this place for anyone who is in the area. The food is awesome they got my order correct and the service is the most outstanding I've ever seen. Thank you very much for enlightening my taste buds to something new.

text: The operation of two lines went very smoothly. I could not see the menu when ordering and probably might not ordered the parfait with oreo topping and fruit because it was 3.75 by itself with the combo 6.00. Good though with their famous lemonade I always bought in brookwood mall homewood Alabama as an employee of both end chain stores when I was in retail employment. Things are vastly different these days. I took my minimum wages way more seriously than majority and as a result the easiest to be the odd ball Not defying the odds that hard work pays. It leaves you struggling in poverty. But Im sure that's bitterness rubbing off on me. Got a good photo as my other favorite thing to do getting odd shots most get paid big bucks in print media. My phone controls the best of me but I got this from my destination mall and purpose on a gorgeous stressfilled easter weekend. In auburn Alabama where I worked in undergraduate school there at now gone jcpennys and got my earring piercing on top of my ear that took a year to heal because I kept hitting it with the phone receiver back in 1989 rather than continue commuting on weekends back to my hometown birmingham mall as manager of lingerie and top sales in accessories. When stockings used with garter belts came 3 to a box and my thighs slightly smaller but not much. Its control top reinforced toe now for sharp talon nails on eagle soarers. My joke of the city. And the river a few miles before this chick-fil-a restaurant. If you ordered a ice cream cake from now replaced Badkung Robbins in toomers corner I made it as the cake maker/ decorator for a quarter. Loved that job slicing tubs of ice cream and layering with cake then icing with melted cream inside the cooler before piping your favorite slogan on it. Lastly, was now gone a different cooler in environmental management for water samples which storied life experienced escaped discussion in the water sludge cleaning treatment process I endured to get mosquitos in my puddled location. I will have better to discuss another day when my dining room and laundry socket plugs work again reminding me of my molester's house dynamics that's my Unavoidable problem.

name: Alyson Gulledge
text: After having so many mistakes with my orders throughout the past few months at the Chick-Fil-A in Sylacauga, today really topped it off. After my order being messed up and one of my coworkers not getting lunch, I called and let them know the order was not included. This was around 11:30ish. The girl told me her general manager wasn’t there and she would have to get approval from him to fix my order. And she tried telling me I would have to somehow prove that the order wasn’t included, asked me to bring it all back up there when I had already distributed over 5 orders to my coworkers! Not even 20 minutes later Kayleen Turner called them and she says the general manager is there he is just busy, so they lied and she called them out on it and the girl had nothing to say but she offered to bring us the order. She didn’t even want it anymore so she said no just to refund her money. I get a call HOURS later saying I would have to go in the store and get cash because they can’t process it otherwise. Okay, cool. It was very inconvenient but sure. Shortly after they called me, they called Kayleen and she wasn’t able to answer because she was in the middle of selling a car. So after, she called back and said “Hey I missed a call from y’all, it was probably about the order for Alyson” and the girl HUNG UP ON HER! So I went in and not once did the manager apologize, not once did she seem to care about the inconvenience, I even brought up the fact that her coworker lied to me on the phone and she said “the gm didn’t get here until 11.” I told her it was well after 11 that I called and she had nothing to say, did not apologize, just said “have a good night.” and quickly went on to help another customer. Y’all after working in the food industry for so long, it baffles me how some fast food employees AND managers can be so unprofessional, especially when they work at the number one fast food restaurant in the country and are known for treating customers with kindness. I promise I never want to be THAT person, but there’s only so far you can push me. I have never been one to try to lie and haggle to get free food out of any restaurant, and it pisses me off that THEY messed up my order, lied to me, treated me unprofessionally, but I am looked at by them as one of those customers that was there to cuss someone out over them leaving a chicken nugget out of my nugget meal. It is literally not hard at all to treat a customer the right way and I just can’t comprehend how that is so hard for some people to understand. 😑

resp.text:
Hi, Alyson. I’m sorry you had such a poor experience at my restaurant. As the local owner of only one restaurant, I’m dedicated to training and continuously improving our team of over 80 local employees.

We messed up, and I’m sorry it happened to you.

I’m always replying to guest concerns via phone if given the opportunity so that I can receive feedback, get better, and make situations right.

If you would be willing to speak with me directly, you may leave a message with a manager at my restaurant’s number: 256-245-0096.

I’m a local Franchisee and I care about this community and my team’s job security, so thank you for your feedback.

-Micah Harris, Chick-fil-A at Sylacauga

text: I absolutely love Chick-fil-A and am really glad to have it in my hometown.  However this one, just like everything else in my hometown, is below Chick-fil-A standards.  I use the curbside pickup regularly to obtain points on the app.  They have left stuff out of my order on numerous occasions.  I normally let it go, but the one time I go back and say something the lady does not even apologize for leaving it out of my order.  So I call back to talk to the manager, she apologizes but does not offer to do anything about it or anything.  So when I ask are you going to do anything, she said it was just honey mustard.  That isn't the point, the point is you left it out of my bag when I requested it in there.  If I did not love Chick-fil-A so much and used to work there so I love supporting them I would not go back to this restaurant.  Note this has been the only Chickfila I have ever been too that I have had issues with.

I’m sorry you had a poor experience, Jason. As a Chick-fil-A Franchisee for four years, I work full-time with my team of over 100 local employees to improve our performance. We are grateful for your feedback. I hope to meet you on your next visit to my restaurant! 🙂
-Micah Harris, Local Franchisee

text: I asked for a grilled chicken club combo or a number 7.  I started eating it once I got home.  Well the sandwich wasn't correct,  I received a piece of grilled chicken, lettuce, and bread. I have never to service like this at any chick fil a. The one in sylacauga is horrible.  Check your food  and the young ladies inside laughed at me when I brung it back.

name: Hannah Martin
text: Excellent food, clean bathrooms, and kind staff. I could never have asked for a better Chick-fil-A experience. In all my life I've never been to a better Chick-fil-A than this. When I look back on my visit to this Chick-fil-A it brings me some much joyful delight that I can hardly bear it! This. This Chick-fil-A right here is the reason why i get out of bed every morning. Just knowing that a Chick-fil-A like this exists in this very state, country, continent, world, solar system, galaxy, and universe makes me happy beyond compare! Please take a nice little trip to this Chick-fil-A and you will surely experience this same feeling of utter and complete ecstasy as I did when walking into this fine eating establishment. Thank you for existing.

resp.text: Thank you, Hannah, for visiting our locally owned and operated Chick-fil-A at Sylacauga! It’s our pleasure to serve you.

There were not other cars around and no people so im am still unsure what prompted his action. He then took a picture of our tag and said he would report our car if we ever disrespected HIS parking lot etiquette again. Needless to say we left without purchase and will not be returning to this chcik fil a again.

text: Friendly and respectful workers. Read the other reviews, people need to realize they are a new business trying to get started and are doing well. If I was a manager knowing if business at night is slow and it may cost more to be open I believe I'd close early too. We also had a long list on our order and it was exact with no ISSUES.

text:
Messed up order twice in a row.
Typical fast food place, no big deal.  My issue is with the employees here.

It seems like each and every one of them is on some type of drug. Sad, really.
Definitely won’t be back

name: Shaun Bailey
text: Been 3 times, all 3 have been bad. Long waits, staff that doesn't seem to know what they're doing, staff is always on their phones or standing outside the drive thru smoking. My last visit ordered an Oreo shake, got oreo and nerds. You would think the rainbow colored ice cream in an oreo shake would have made them think why, but no.

name: melissa joyner
text: 1 star only cause there is not a zero. We decided to get a burger at sonic, hoping for a hot burger. We ordered 2 cheese burger meals and 2 jr burger kid meals, the cashier didnt even know how to ring up a kid meal and charged me for a regular adult meal and he didnt even ask anyone how to ring it up. EVERYTHING was cold. All the burgers were COLD, all the fries were COLD. And when we started eating the burger an onion peel was in the burger patty. This was the worst food I have ever had. I will not recommend this restaurant and I will NEVER go back to that restaurant.

name: Kameron Pocus
text: Pretty good, weird but good. Will B coming back. Clean, nice, and a fun team!

name: Cody B (Good)
text: Get new management, or close it down. Service and food quality has been in a rapid decline since opening only a few months ago. Four customers in line, 10 minute wait, charged for the wrong order, and given the wrong order. Both fry orders were shrivelled, hard, and cold. Drinks were watered down.

name: Dalton Simrell
text: I was told to wait before my order could be taken. No problem. 5.. 10.. 15.. 20.. 25 minutes go by and I have still been sitting on hold in the drive thru for 25 minutes while the waiting to take my order during the process the woman that is taking the order is cursing over the microphone very loudly with my children in the vechicle. All the while there were 3 employees outside on a smoke break... what in the world.... terrible service and I will never go here again and I will encourage everyone I know to never come to this dump of an establishment

name: Sheri Jones
text: I gave them three chances, but unfortunately they will no longer get my business. Ordered large onion rings and got four oinion rings. FOUR. Next ordered a footlong chili hot dog. Got a footlong cheese dog. Just cheese. They would be a good place if the employees would get off their phones, open their ears and close the mouth.

name: Kwana S
text: Waited until my third negative experience to post anything. Went there the other day and the drive thru was closed because four people didn't show up to work. Ordered a bacon cheeseburger toaster only to get home and realize it did not even have a burger on the sandwich. Food is always cold! I will never go back!

name: Keith B.
text: Unfortunately it's been like this from day one, very slow and yes they are trying, usually it's not the staff and that's if there lead or supervisor is being proactive, Sonic corperate has to take the lead in good work ethics and training, this is customer driven service, we want good service and apparently this is what we pay for!

name: Alan Thompson
text:
Great live half mile from sonic been here 23 years need something like this. Great service
great food.
Whoever rated low needs to go to Popeyes!!!!

name: TryhardLogan
text: Went there at 10:20pm and they were supposed to be open until 11pm. No answer from drive thru and knocked on window and no one was there. Don't state you are open until 11 if your incompetent workers can't manage to do an easy job.

name: John Waites
text: First burger I got the toppings were very ripe and horrible tasted. Second chicken was dry and very stale. Thirds  got a Coney and it was cold and dry. Only thing that was okay was the tots and drinks. Other sonic locations has had better quality food

name: Brandi Hafley
text: Three times now my order has been wrong. This last time I didn't have my receipt because I wasn't given one. Even tho I had the wrong items store would not make it right and replace. Employees act like they dont know half of what's going on around there.

name: davidwilliams4566
text: Milkshake machine is never working. Food is ok.

name: Jay
text: Nice place only problem got Reese’s blast all ice cream just few Reese’s n top disappointed

name: Taylor Madsen
text: This place has closed early 3 times in a week without an excuse. Ridiculous. When asked why they closed early, they said, "idk man my manager just said we're closing early".

name: Monta Smith
text: I been coming here before work amd they always messing up my oreder and get an attitude when I say something about it.

name: Laura Abigail Ward
text: Very clean and the staff is friendly. Happy to have this right here in Moody!

name: Ethan Pettis
text: Slowest Sonic ever. Sat at the drive thru order screen for 10 minutes, no one ever took my order or responded when I spoke.

text: Really nice eating area and modern design!

text: Always great and fast service

name: N C
text: They stay open to 11 but shut down the ice cream machine down by 9 so no desserts during the evening

name: jamesc lee
text: Sign said open all doors are locked

name: pam ferguson
text: Very friendly

name: Crystal Driscoll
text: (Admittingly I eat here probably more often than I should) this Popeye's location has the best customer service, absolute freshest and hottest food!  I would drive all the way across town just to get to this particular location! Hot food..fair price;) (They even take into account when you place an order for chicken tenders; if the chicken tenders run small they make sure to add extra pieces to make it fair).  Popeye's chicken tenders  will never be topped!

name: laz foot
text:
Good chicken, good service, the staff will bend the rules on the coupons if you are nice to them.   The company must really ride their employees hard because at the end of their shift, in the parking lot, they do NOT look happy.

Their chicken beats the hell out of KFC.

name: Joseph Tracy
text: Ordered some chicken tenders and cajun fries, was told to pull forward past the window, and then I proceeded to wait ten minutes for my food.  Three other cars got their food before me.  When I finally went inside my food was waiting on the counter.  Second time this has happened to me.  Never again will I go to this location.  No apology or anything.  Terrible customer service.  I should have made a bigger fuss but I was in a hurry.

name: JERRY MCKEE
text: We go here to eat almost every time we come to Huntsville🤗 It is just the BEST 😜

name: Sam Woodson
text: Had the buffet, I like getting some chicken livers, but not enough to buy a full order so the buffet is great. Also, you can put as much gravy on your potatoes as you want! Banana pudding too! It's kind of crowded. I wish they had to the buffet at one of the other locations in Huntsville that are closer.

name: BARFLEY Bjork
text: A shiny smile after lunch means you just had a good time - BARFLEY

name: William Scott
text: I prefer this location to the south parkway one. They seem to take greater care cooking their food.

text: Good chicken! The only one with a buffet for miles! Maybe in the state!

text: great chicken, great service

text: GREAT Food great service

name: Tiff Bourne
text: The lady that took our order was very nice and professional. The prices for the chicken were pretty good but the fish prices were way too high. Especially since the fish was literally taken out of a frozen bag put into cornmeal and fried. No seasoning and it was pretty small. I guess that's why it's called krispy chicken though. Everything else was pretty good especially the biscuits

name: Marquita Ja'Nice
text: They don't even get 1 star. Ordered a chicken sandwich and it was nothing like the picture. They gave me a processed chicken patty you can buy out of the frozen section of a grocery store. The fries weren't even waffle fries. Then they don't tell you just give you anything.

name: Regina Paul
text: Good parking area, appeared clean on the outside, but I didn't go on in.

name: Kermit Earl Pleasant
text: The food is delicious when it's fresh. But if you're not careful they will serve you anything. Food that's dry and crusty and very hard and dark. they will serve you food that's been sitting out on the line under the heat lamps for over 6 hours or more. They will also serve you old food that's been reheated. If food is also very expensive. I bought a fish combo I got one piece of fish and it cost $6. Not to mention the fish was hard and really dark almost a burned color. It's a hood joint and you get less than what you pay for go go somewhere else.

name: Victor Wray
text: After waiting over 15 minutes.Chicken was dry and  tasted old.  Usually really enjoy there food not today. Lost me as a customer.

name: scott brewster
text: The chicken is excellent! Biscuits are amazing! Fish is only okay. Sides are delicious. Four stars because they're a bit pricey.

name: Freebie Babe
text: Handsdown the best chicken I have ever tasted. Are you serious? The chicken tenders are seasoned all the way through. All the food including the drink was fresh. I had to write a review. How am I just now finding out about this place? It is so hard to find a restuarant that seasons their chicken it's usually bland. I will never eat at another chicken spot besides this one again.

text: They were my fav when traveling through Prattville it was a must but yesterday was disappointing, they have changed their wings that are now smaller than wingettes; which is fine but don’t go up on your prices in the process and some of the wings were not clean as pictured below which is yucky! The server was very nice. They take call ins but don’t prepare them until you arrive at the store unless you prepay over the phone which they don’t ask if you’d like to do to avoid waiting around; so I don’t understand the purpose of call in.

resp.text: Due to many experiences of food not being picked-up from call in orders we have set a new policy on call in orders. You may refer to the info update section for the new policy. We also apologize for the unpleasurable experience on the food. We will review this and improve on this matter. Thank you.

Update:
Thank you for your response.  Unfortunately I will not be returning to this location; but, again I thank you for taking time to respond 8 months later.

resp.text: I apologize for that.. We take protocol and safety extremely seriously especially when it comes to health and the current pandemic. Please refer to the new Covid policy updates on our site. Hope to see you again soon

name: Roy Franks
text: American Deli Inc Is a franchise owned by individuals, so this rating is for the specific  franchisee at the Prattville location. For starters the building is new, so that’s always a plus, unfortunately they cheaped out on the chairs and the backs of them are installed incorrectly. The establishment is nice , and the cashier was friendly. Their CC processor froze while I paid so I had to wait about 10 minutes to pay. The food took about 25 minutes , compared to other locations taking 6-9 minutes. Food wise it’s the same as any other location so the consistency is there. I’m rating 4 stars because it’s a new establishment, I think with proper training this establishment could run as good as the rest of the franchise locations.

resp.text: Thank you for this constructive review! We have improved ten folds since than and also added new delicious items to our menu. Please come by soon and try the new and improved American Deli!

We went in based on the name Deli in the name, but it did not seem like a deli based on what everyone in there was chowing on.

name: Allan Schwindling
text: I made the mistake of stopping at the new Bojangles in Montgomery yesterday. First of all getting in and out of the parking lot is a nightmare. Turning left from Ann street is almost impossible. But that's not my major concern. During my wait in the drive thru I witnessed workers hanging out in the back corner of the parking lot. No big deal. Until one of the girls change a diaper on an infant and throws the used diaper over the fence. My point is, what does this say for a new restaurant. Having employees standing around and not even caring about this incident. Thanks but no thanks. Won't be spending my hard earned money there again.

name: Matthew Voke
text: Good food.

name: Mitch B
text: Typical Bojangles food and environment, but my experience was marred by poor service. On a Sunday lunch, the store was poorly staffed, the staff that was present seemed to be untrained by the poor service I received, and the food quality was lacking. If you are a Montgomery local, unless things change, visit the Eastchase location.

resp.text: Mitch, would mind sending us additional information on your visit to social@bojlangles.com?

name: AA Beauty
text: I give bojangles 5 stars. The chicken is always hot and fresh. Great spot to stop to eat while traveling.

name: Steven Penny
text: Apparently they were originally giving out incorrect size cups for the first few weeks so I was expecting a larger size when I placed an order tonight. Instead of just saying sorry for the confusion, offering me the medium cup or asking if I'd like to pay the difference, the male manager that took my order just acted like it was my problem. I was annoyed but I drove away and wanted to eat the Mac and cheese but they didn't give me any utensils(I was working) so I had to dig around my car and luckily I saved some plastic ones from another restaurant. I then tried to eat and there was a hair in my food. I went back received a refund and was told sorry by the cashier and possibly another manager that was around but the male manager that had to process the refund didn't have anything to say.....hair in the food and you couldn't say sorry for the inconvenience? Not anything major, just disgusting hair where it shouldn't belong and not very cheery attitude from the manager. I can get the same service from KFC if I wanted...which I don't and they've been around for years.

name: Chelsea Dodge
text: The girl that is working the register this evening was the most rude and ugly person. I ordered a drink with my salad and was giving attitude about it then no dressing no forks and she acted like it was above her to do her job. I won't be eating there for a while.

name: Shaun James
text:
I visited bojangles at about 8:40 pm on 1/7/2018 .
My experience with this reastaurant establishment was not a good one.I went through the drive through and waited about 10 mins before i received my food.I didn’t find out my order was incorrect until i got home.I had to ask for napkins and a fork.When i asked for hot sauce for my chicken they told me they was out .Who sales chicken without hot sauce? The 2 guys who worked the window was very rude..They act like i was bothering them for asking for things that was suppose to come with your meal.

resp.text: Shaun, we're very sorry to hear this. Can you please email the details to marketing@landonholdingsinc.com?

text:
I had lunch here for the first time. The food came out hot, quickly, and the chicken tasted fresh. The facility was clean; the staff was very friendly and eager to assist. Well managed restaurant.

I'm not big on chain restaurants but I would visit this one again.

text: We went to the zaxby's on Zelda road I knew something was not going to go right when I saw the young man coming from outside his car with his pants dirty his shirt dirty got food horrible called young man got smart and refused to allow us to talk to the manager.  Will not go back to this one. Dalraida one is the best

text: They told me that my boneless wings were gonna be fresh that’s why it was taking so long. Then they put everything else in the bag until the wings got done . Meaning all the chicken and fries were already cold. Additionally they didn’t even give us all the extra sauces we ordered

name: Oris Lawhorn
text: Zabys zelda rd Montgomery Alabama.  Awful old hard chicken

text: Sat in the drive through line for 35 mins!!! Instead of telling anyone they weren’t taking anymore orders they just stayed silent!!! It’s now 9:44pm CT they don’t close till 10pm. It’s unprofessional and rude. If I could give 0 stars I would. I used to be apart of the Zaxby’s crew in my hometown.

name: Emily Yup
text: ordered 2 sandwiches at 7:00pm via ubereats. 30 minutes later i get an update that they just dropped the filets into the fryer.

name: Nun Ya
text: Let me start by saying I really liked this place in the beginning. My family and I would eat here all the time. Food is ok, prices decent, and service is cool, if you want that type. Buuuuut... here lately  lines are out to the street and then you may or may not get to place a order even after a long wait. The last time we went the wait was about 30 mins to even get to the speaker. Then just when the very polite young lady comes over the speaker all I could hear was someone  yelling in the background.  I was placed on hold about another 2 mins and then she came back over the speaker, very apologetic ,and stated they have RUN OUT OF FOOD????? Really??? Smh. Idk If I'll be going back after that anytime soon.

name: Berneice Guilford
text: Slow service and the line wasn't long. Just slow.  Food not hot. Fries tasted stale and  not hot.

name: Bebop
text: Fast service, good fresh food, attitude having order taker, but the lady at the window is always very sweet every time I go there.

name: teresa allan
text: Very good. Following Covid-19 guidlines

name: Jakolbie Ozley

text: I waited in line 45 minutes with 8 cars ahead of me. Order spicy,8pc,white.paid $20. Got my order,drove home it was 7pc mixed, not spicy. I called and was put on hold over 10 minutes until I hung up. Just 1 of many bad orders at this one.

text: They are so Good

name: Theressa Coleman
text:
My husband ate at the original Popeyes in New Orleans he now has vowed to never eat Popeyes Again. This store is disgraced to the Popeye's name. This is the third Popeyes in Birmingham that we went to with a handwritten sign on your Order Board saying  pull up to the window. So therefore everybody has to order at the window it literally took us 45 minutes to get to the window and then my husband said the chicken was Horrible & who can mess up mashed potatoes and gravy he said it comes in a pouch you just pour it out and microwave it but it was Scorched.
Come on Popeyes straighten up your act..

name: Step East
text: Popeyes Fried Chicken, Red Beans & Rice and French Fries are the best. The service we received at this location was fast and friendly and our Drive-Thru order was prepared and handed out correctly. We will definitely visit this Popeyes again soon..

text: The staff was ghetto. The gentleman was trying to take my order but the staff was standing around him talking loudly he couldn't hear me and I couldn't hear him. They were out of tenders. Even when I pulled up to the window it was wide open and the staff was still talking extremely loud to include the managers. No one was working I guess everyone was on break all at once. They staff needs to be trained in etiquette there was none there.

name: Da Avigo
text:
Employees working on 4/23 evening should be FIRED!!! A charter bus driver was trying to get food and they denied service. We are from Texas and that was very upsetting! Supervisor, PLEASE address that problem ASAP. Truck and motor coach drivers should not be denied service, because those vehicles can NOT go on the drive-thru even if the wanted to. SMH!
Bad customer service

Has the management changed ?

I ordered my food at 2:29 and received my food at 2:57... never coming to this Popeyes again, and I wouldn’t suggest this Popeyes to anyone else. If I could give a review without giving a star, I would. They don’t deserve one star.

My husband's is always complaining  about that.

text: Although I own never want to complain because I once worked in fast food but this particular location always has some type of issues I love the product that they sell what's a customer service need some work and the people on the front end registers should be better trained how to take orders I ordered a 3-piece combo and I requested that I have spicy chicken to Wings and a thigh and he rang it up as mild and I noticed it on the receipt the manager came in corrected it verbally to the kitchen staff and they still gave it to me wrong but the lines were so long and the drive-thru was so backed up until I just set and ate my food I also would like to say I think that it is pathetic as high as Popeye's Chicken already he is that you started charging for gravy not for chicken but for gravy I think that is absolutely asinine I mean that's just an option with or without gravy I don't understand how that changed and why but anyway I'm sure this probably will fall on deaf ears and there'll be no follow-up but you have really lost a loyal customer pool service in high prices don't go together

name: Danielle B. Turner
text: I placed my order on the app at 10:50pm. I arrived at the Sonic at 11:25pm. I checked in and it took 20 mins (11:45pm) for the screen to change and say the name of the employee that was going to be out with my food. I waited 10 extra mins (11:55pm) for my order and it still didn't not come I hit the button and the guy said he was looking at my order and was going to send it right out. Keep in mind the store closes at midnight. 10 more mins pass one for the employees came to the car ( no food in her hands) asked what was I waiting on. When I told her my mobile order she went to go get it . She brings back my order (12:15) my corn dogs were warm, my fries and tots were ice cold, my Hi-C that wasn't suppose to have any ice had ice in it and the ice had melted making my drink watered down, my coke barely had ice in it but it was watered down and my limeade tasted like nothing but water with a hint of flavor. I went to the window and nobody acknowledged me so i went to the drive-thru. Granted they still had a line of cars in the drive-thru I went ahead and got in the drive-thru line. I got to the speaker and the person proceeded to tell me that they were closed. I told them was wrong with my order and they did not correct my drinks and brought me tots and fries that tasted like they had been fried in salt instead of grease. I would like a full refund for what I spent. I was highly disappointed by my food and was not able to enjoy any of what I brought I ended up cooking when I got home.

resp.text: Hi Danielle. Thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We are sorry to hear you did not have a good experience. Please call us at 1-888-257-8100 or visit http://bit.ly/1EOeLMc if you would like to provide more details.

name: Kymberly Cole
text: I just went to Sonic Drive-In in Hueytown. I placed my order at 9:43 pm. At 10:15 I asked where was my order? The guy I asked, automatically responded with an attitude by telling me that he was the only person bringing orders out and he was the manager. And he can't run his store for bringing out orders. I explained to him how long myself and my husband had been sitting there, he replied, I'm not gonna argue with you and walked away. They finally come out with food  that wasn't mine and asked for payment. I told the girl that I had already paid for my food and she argued that I hadn't. I will not be going back again. And I will be calling corporate to let them know how their SO CALLED manager cursed and spoke to me and my husband

resp.text: Thank you for messaging us, Kymberly. We agree, that is unacceptable and we apologize. Figured it was just because the dumpster was across the way but dude, it was bad.  After waiting in line another good eh, 10-15min I got to the window.  The employees were inside cursing and fighting and the guy that opened the window said something along the lines of "I just wanna go home".  My Reeses shake was soft serve in a cup with a couple Reeses bits on top, nothing mixed in. Yeah, won't be going back until management actually shows up for work and you probably shouldn't either.

If you haven't been by lately, give them another shot! You'll really be amazed at the difference in the staff, the food, the prompt and timely service, and the overall atmosphere. text: My visit was 30 minutes and all I ordered was a shake and blast.  I press the button and a lady can on the speaker and once I started telling my order she said please hold.  I waited 15 minutes and in the mean time another customer pulled up on the other side and pushed the button and immediately got assistance.  I pushed the button again and the lady took my order.  I know they were busy during to the promotion but they need to make sure customers don't have to wait a long period of time and also take order in order by arrival.

text: Wow!! I can't believe how stupid some employees can be. We waited 20 minutes to get 2 sodas. The drive thru speaker was broke, so ok no problem. Finally our turn. She takes the money and walks away without giving us our drinks!!! 5 more minutes trying to get their attention. Did they really think we were there just to give them our money? We will be finding another drink stop!!

name: Vil SumWolf
text:
Decided to visit the Sonic in Hueytown, AL during happy hour for a Root 44 frozen lemonade, both large drinks were correctly made an product tasted efficiently. Restrooms were maintained an outside eatery area was in order like any busy Sonic. Only defect of visit was drive through intercom to place your order, screens work but communication device wasn't properly working. I could hardly hear the server on the other end an same I guess her end on the machine. Also number on my stall was unavailable so had to tell the server where I was which was a tad bit annoying.

Price: $$ & 1/2

Pro: clean restrooms upon visit, order was correct, parking lot was presentable, server was respectful.

Con: Order mechanism for drive through wasn't function correctly, had to tell server on intercom which stall I was occupying, intercoms also fizzled an have to raise your voice in order to hear you...

Final Note: Please Sonic fix your machine's in the ordering stalls & review notes will change...

Worst drive thru ever. I waited 15 minutes for my wings. I was literally the only person there. The entire time I could hear the staff cussing, yelling, laughing and carrying on. I heard one of the staff say "bring that dude his S*** before he drive off" to which the other replied "he ain't gone drive off, he already payed". When I finally got my food a younger guy with a crustache basically threw me my food, slammed the window and ran back to where he came from. I knocked on the window and honored my horn for anther two minutes until he came back so I could get some ranch. It would have been nice he asked me if I needed sauce. What kind of psychopath doesn't need sauce for their wings. F this place, f that staff, this is exactly why Hueytown is going in the gutter. And that staff is doing something sketchy in the back.

Wings taste like microwaved turds. The ocean water is delicious of course.

name: Ed Torres
text: I burned my hands in the Men's Bathroom because of a defective faucet at this location Churches Chicken #237. See the video of the defective faucet and how hot the water was. When I first forced the faucet open it went for the hot section but it was until after I put my hands below the faucet that the water transitioned to steamy hot and burned by hands. I complained to the first person that identified themselves as "one of the managers" and showed her how it happened and I burned my hands, all she said was "thank you for reporting it". Nothing like "is there anything that I can do to help you" or "do you want some ice etc." nothing. So I ended up calling the police to report it and showed the same to the police. The real manager waited until the officer was outside to start talking to me and he immediately began doubting what I was telling him so I told him that I can't talk to him because he works here. The police called the fire dept., they came and told me that they can't do anything about a burn, it will have to take its course. I am concerned for blisters in my hand. Will give an update later.

And they also need to have a district number where people can complain because when you ask them for the number they would not give it to you or they say that there is no number and if you call the number that's on the receipt that's the same place you just left from where you want to make a complaint about.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: I had a taste for some chicken and decided on Church's. Upon arriving at the drive thru, I just sat there waiting on someone to come on the intercom. 11 minutes later and me saying hello twice, no one came on, so I drove around to go inside. When I came inside, there was only 1 person inside. They were soooo slow. I asked for some smokehouse chicken and the cashier was kind enough to ask me did I want fresh chicken, would I be willing to wait? I said sure. It was around 8ish so it wasn't busy. While waiting on some fresh chicken, I noticed some interesting facts. The health score was not posted or visible....then one of the employees said the health inspector put it in the men's bathroom....??? and the score was supposed to have been a 94..?? Also, the use of hair nets was not a practice. The fryers had  a bin up under it with with some type of yellow hose going into it...??? The cook did have a hat on and was trying to swap out the racks to place more chicken on it and it fell into the grease. He picked it up and just scraped off the stuck on crumbs with a scraper and sat it back down. I was shocked. All the while the cashier and another employee looking for the health score. They didn't find it  and she called the manager, but no one knew where it was...??? I was happy to get some fresh chicken and the cashier was nice enough to throw in a free biscuit. As I was leaving, one of the employees was taking a smoke break, sitting down  in front of the restaurant talking loud on the phone and using some choice words.The chicken was good.The environment and work stations need cleansing, up to date frying machines need to be installed and a refresher course on conversing in the midst of customers. But as equally important.."DISPLAY YOUR HEALTH SCORE"! After all, hanging on the wall it said it must be placed in a conspicuous place.

The way this Zaxby’s is set up, once you’re in the drive thru, you can’t get out. Afterwards, a girl rudely proceeds to say “we’re closed.” After trying to explain that we were sitting in the drive through for almost an hour, she continued to RUDELY cut us off and say they were closed. Multiple cars we’re sitting in the drive through for over 45 minutes with us. Ridiculous.

text: I had just been jumped by the reality TV star Cranjis McBasketBall, and had nothing left. I was in utter disrepair and had no idea what to do. I decided to get off of my worn in couch and drive myself to the nearest Zaxby's. It was the greatest and most influential decision I have ever made. Not only did my Cajun Club cure me of all my wounds and sins, it made me see life completely differently. The world seemed brighter, and I became a very positive person. Almost as positive as Chris Treager. I am now an owner of a paper company and have many friends, including a famous Beet farmer. Thank you Zaxby's for changing my life and  letting me see what I have been missing out on in life, Thank you.

text: My son loves this place.  He would rather have Zaxby's than ice cream.  He always gets a kiddie finger with a milk.  If it's lunch, we let him get a brownie, too.  No brownies after dinner, though.  Chocolate gets him wound up and he has trouble going to sleep.  If he has trouble going to sleep then the dog has trouble going to sleep because the dog sleeps with me and won't sleep if I'm up trying to get my son to go to sleep.  If the dog can't sleep, she itches because she has bad skin.  I think she's allergic to people, but I can't tell because to see if she gets better when she's not around people, I would have to stand at such a great distance from her I wouldn't be able to see her skin.  It's sort of a tree falling in the woods sort of thing, I guess.  Anyway... To recap... Zaxby's is good.  Skip the brownie after 5 or it will ruin your week

name: Jim Nolan
text:
This place seems to go through more night managers and staff more than any other place.  I don't know what their problem is, but it is NOT getting better.  I have had the WORST experiences here over the past year and a half.  I'll get so mad at the screwed up order that I take it back and get a refund.  I've even gone inside and the LAST time, I waited 45 minutes to get my food.  I BLEW UP when the manager had to ask me what I'd ordered after 45 minutes.  I told him to give me my money back.  I've never EVER seen such poorly trained and lazy employees.
I'm not a glutton for punishment.  I spoken to the manager, explained the situation, requested a refund and then after about three months, I figure it's safe to go back... NO.  It has just gotten worse.  I couldn't understand because no other Zaxby's I've visited is like this.  Then I discovered they are individually owned.  If you file a complaint at their website, they say they will 'route' it to the appropriate location managment...  Zaxby's needs to know how bad this place makes them look.  It's unfortunate because this place is near my office and I work late many nights...  if you go to this particular location, you've been warned. BTW, the order was and has always been my favorite, buffalo chicken tenders with celery.  If I manage to get the order completed, it is usually missing pieces or has no celery or has on brown soft stick of what was once celery.  I'll get so irritated that I won't come back for three months -hoping it will get better... the last time was the 45+ minute wait --just to get my money back and my blood pressure sent through the ceiling.  Maybe I AM a glutton for punishment because I really like those tenders and maybe I'll try the order again -it's coming up on my three month cycle anyhow.. :-) I'll let you know.

name: Hunter Garnett
text:
Zaxby's operates on a higher plane of taste and customer satisfaction, and I was formerly under the impression that nothing in this fallen world could be done to taint the aura of this chicken-centric establishment. However, Oxmoor Zaxby's launched an arrow into restaurant heaven and somehow struck an unassuming member of the righteous Zaxby's Legion, thus bringing that angel of a food provider down to this sinful earth to create the very institution about which this review is written. May the doer of this awful deed be cast out to an awful place where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

But for real, the service has been slow and very sub-par the times I've been. The food is not as quality as the average fast-food meal and the experience is overall not a pleasant one when compared to other Zaxby's locations. There's another location about 10 minutes down the road (1304 Montgomery Hwy) that's a little better, and one about 15 minutes away (2636 Valleydale Rd) that truly captures all that is good about Zaxby's. I reccomend going the extra mile because the staff at Oxmoor Zaxby's certainly won't.

I have given this location one more star than it deserves simply because Zaxby's.

name: Ronnie Gamble
text: We had a great meal with personal service from Jessica our bartender.  The restaurant seating was still limited due to covid, so we sat at the bar without having to wait.  Jessica was constantly moving washing glasses, getting her bar mixes prepared, mixing drinks and was always updating us on our orders.  The steaks were cooked to perfection.   We made a wise choice in eating here.  Thanks for a pleasant experience.

resp.text: Ronnie, the pleasure is ours! We're happy to hear Jessica could help you feel right at home. We look forward on your next visit🍻

name: Tomjr z28
text: Great food and a damn good server the folks at the door could use some help

name: Daishaun Morgan
text: There are having staffing issues. They need help the poor manager was doing everything just to keep orders moving. The wait time was to long, so we went next door. We will give them another try in a month or so. Usually great food and service.

resp.text: Daishaun, we are very sorry to hear about the wait time. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Mike Hayes
text:
Me and my dad went here for lunch.
The service is located the African-American bus man that was helping bring stuff to the table was very polite had very very good manners.

But when I tell you the cook overcooked my daddy's fried shrimps until they were and cook my grilled strips until they were tough and burnt on the outside.

And my daddy's steak was tough..

Those are just the facts..

Get the cook away from the stove and maybe let him prepare salads probably won't be going back there

resp.text: Mike, we're so sorry to hear about the issue with the fried shrimps and grilled steak. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the Trussville store. If you'd like us to follow up with you, please reach out here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Sorry again for the inconvenience.

name: Mary Conner
text: Steak wasn't cooked medium rare the first time. We travel a far to eat here every weekend.  Spoke  to manager  Greg and he had our ribeye steaks cooked. The 2nd time cooked was medium rare.  Thank you Greg for making our trip worth it. Will ask for you.  No wait for my adopted Nither thats in a wheelchair with dementia.

resp.text: Mary, it was a pleasure to serve you. We gladly share feedback like this with our Trussville team so we can make your next visit worthy of 5 stars. See you again soon! 🍻🥜

name: mason Reeves
text: The food was great the server was really really great i loved my visit the place was clean just a wonderful place hi highly recommend

resp.text: Mason, we’re happy to hear that! We're glad you had an awesome visit 🤘

name: Tommy Morris
text: My wife and I decided to stop by after doing some shopping. We go in and the guy tells us it'll be 40 minutes.. well it's 8 p.m. on a Thursday night and they close at 9..We tell him no thanks and as we are walking out  we count 5 tables that just haven't been cleaned off and the bus boy is sitting in a chair playing on his phone. It's already limited seating due to the social distance. You'd think they'd be more focused on getting the tables cleaned faster.. maybe this is one reason why they have low ratings.

resp.text: Tommy, thank you so much for bringing this matter to our attention. Please know we take your feedback seriously and will be following up with the Trussville location. Rest assured that we'll pass your message along to our team.

name: Nesser C
text: Had two fantastic Ribeye Steak dinner for Mother's day and they were cooked perfect! Placed the order online and when I went to pickup my order, it was ready, waiting on me! Hats off to the chef! Job well done 👏

resp.text: Nesser, we're so happy that your ribeye steak was served to your satisfaction. See you again soon for another delicious steak day!🥩

name: Alandris Ferguson
text: So many things went wrong. I couldn't use my gift card online because it didn't have a PIN. That in itself wasn't a big deal. I called to place my order. Not only was my order sent to the wrong location, items I requested on the order were left off. When I got the confirmation email, I called the location that it went to, which was this location, and asked them to add what was left off. The person said she'd get it added. I showed up to pick up the order and those items were still not on the order. Also, part of the order was overcooked.

resp.text: Alandris, we're sincerely sorry about the issue with your recent online order experience. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Ronnie Dalton
text: Baked sweet potato was hard, no taste, had to ask for refill on drinks, order of Cole slaw was left of tray, and cole slaw was bitter tasting

resp.text: Ronnie, we're sorry we let you down with our food and service. Please connect with us directly at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ so we can share this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Todd Peterson
text: Much better than the last time I was here, steak and chicken were great, server Daniel was very attentive to our table.

resp.text: Todd, we’re happy to hear that our steak and chicken hit the spot and that Daniel took good care of you! See y’all again real soon 🍻

name: Cherelle Randolph
text: We usually have a good experience eating here, but tonight was bad. I had some sort of spicy rice in my to go plate that I did not order. My fiance ordered his steak well done and it was rare. We didn't have all of our condiments for the sides, our food wasn't hot and the rolls were almost burned. I couldn't get in touch with anyone over the telephone that could possibly fix my issues.

resp.text: Cherelle, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. This gives us a better understanding of what we are doing well and what we can improve on. We’ll work on it in the meantime and feel free to contact us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ if you have more to share.

name: Eric C. Stewart
text:
Ordered sirloin tips. Steak was crispy burnt, and I ordered tips medium. It was ordered with the mushrooms and grilled onions.

The quality of the mushrooms compared to Texas Roadhouse was mediocre. The onions were not grilled they looked like they were thrown on there right before food was brought out.

resp.text: Eric, sorry to hear that the food fell short of your expectations. We would like to learn more and share it with our Trussville team. Please let us know the details by contacting us here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/.

name: corlis mccurdy
text:
Our hostess was Michael
He was very professional and really just kind and deligent in making sure our order was correct. We truly loved his attitude!!! He score 💯 all around

resp.text: Corlis, we’re glad to hear that Michael could help you feel right at home! We’ll pass along the kudos. See you again soon 👋

name: Becky Barnett
text: Enjoyed my visit to Logans. The steak and salad and potatoes was delicious.  I enjoyed being my family. It very usual for us to get to go out in this pandemic. Thank you for the great service.

resp.text: Becky, thanks for joining us! We're glad to hear you and your family had a great time. We hope to see you again soon for more of our delicious steaks and salad! 👋

name: Michele Reavis
text: Since they have reopened, the food is inferior to before. The steaks were smaller. The new appetizer we tried was tasty, but small. We got the supposed 1/2 pound bacon appetizer. Came with 5 pieces of bacon 4-6 inches long and maybe 3/8 inch thick on skewers with a small amount of fried onions and some BBQ sauce for $9.99. My chopped steak tasted like char in a few places. The 22 oz Porterhouse steaks my husband and son got were small looking. None of the steaks were cooked property. My Mom asked for Med Well and got rare. We had to ask for croutons on the salads. The waitress was apparently new because everytime we asked about something she remarked this was her first night serving. Did bring a new potato for my husband when he forgot to order it with no sour cream. Not impressed over all.

resp.text: Michele, we sincerely apologize that we let you down in preparing your steaks. Please connect with us directly at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ so we can share this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Haylee Hopper
text: I did a pick up order today and I had ordered two-dozen rolls. When I got home and opened the boxes they looked horrible. I wish it would let me add the pictures I took! Most of them were brown and hard. I’m sorry, but I’m not wasting my money on this.

resp.text: Haylee, oh no! We're very sorry to hear this happened to you. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again.  Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? We'd like to get a few more details as we definitely want to address this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Pam Rhoton
text: Jessica was a great person considering look like she was the only one working we will be back as lot as she is our server thank b

resp.text: Pam, we’re glad to hear that Jessica could help you feel right at home! We’ll pass along the kudos. See you again soon 👋

name: Teresa Cox
text:
The food was good and the service was good.
However, we sat where we could see the open kitchen and we were watching a female server eating French fries while packaging up to go orders. The open kitchen area was very dirty. We asked for salt and pepper, they brought dirty unsanitized shakers that were definitely greasy snd dirty.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about your recent visit, Teresa. Please reach out to us by sending an email at GuestExperience@SPBHospitality.com and we’ll get this addressed immediately.

name: Evan Maltass
text: The manager is attempting to host and doing a poor job of it. Half of the tables in this building including and entire corner are empty, yet he says it's a 45 minute wait. Social distancing can not be the reason because this would be 12 feet apart. The tables that have dishes on them from previous customers are still sitting there and i been here for 30 minutes. So, no hostess, no busboy, slow service, unorganized and very frustrating. Ah and now I see the manager clearing off those tables I mentioned earlier. So he's doubling as a hostess and busboy. Get your restaurant together sir. 1 star.

resp.text: We're so sorry to hear about the service you experienced, Evan. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: CYNTHIA DAVISON
text: Waitress was nice young girl..helpful..kept checking on us...did not forget about us...

resp.text: CYNTHIA, glad one of our staff did a great job checking in on you. If there’s anything we can do to improve, kindly let us know by mentioning our Trussville Logan’s at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Thanks for stoppin’ by!

name: Orante Frazier
text: This may be the best service my wife and I have every had.

resp.text: Orante, we love hearing our Trussville location took care of you. Thank you for the 5 stars and see you again soon 👋

name: yolanda moore
text: Staff and the manager Tiffany were great  but you can't operate a restaurant with friendliness alone. The food needs to be half way decent  to balance it out. After eating at long horn steak house your expectations are set really high and unfortunately Logans didn't come close nor does saltgrass steak house . I did enjoy my drink at logans can't remember the name   ,it comes out of a frozen like smoothe machine and the rolls were good. My mom enjoyed her food, but she haven't been to long horn yet.

resp.text: yolanda, we’re sorry to hear that the food wasn't served to your liking. If you are willing to chat with a manager, please connect with us here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Your honest feedback is always welcome.

name: Brennita Bostic
text: Waited 45 minutes for a table after making reservations to having me n my kids sit a 2 different tables when there was plenty of booths that was not in use... They gave a booth that could easily fit 6 people to a party of 2 food came out cold... 1st and last time going to this location in trussville never again... Worse service ever amd im not the 1 to complain but my experience there was awful

resp.text: Brennita, we're so sorry to hear about the service you experienced. Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? We'd like to get a few more details as we definitely want to address this with the Trussville team and make things right.

name: Briana Robinson
text: This place is awful. The food is always under-done or over-done and the bar tender didn't even acknowledge my friend and I while we were at the bar until I made a comment about us sitting there while he cleaned the bar top off. We had been sitting for a solid 15 minutes at this point. I do not recommend.

resp.text: Briana, we're very sorry to hear this happened to you. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Tracy Estes
text: So my husband and I order from Logan’s (mostly in Mobile Al I 65 and Airport location.) but tonight we ordered from Trussville Al where we were staying. We love the Food and the rolls. But every time no matter WHERE we order my husband always order the chopped steak dinner and whether we order online and put notes or we call in the order and actually talk to someone and order. We always ask for the chopped steak to not have the mashed potatoes and no mushrooms....but apparently these folks that work for this company does not have the ability to do this. So my husband had enough picked up his order and double checked it. There it was mashed potatoes, ask the worker for a couple of napkins and scooped them out of the to go box and off the meat and payed it in the counter. But I doubt they will get it right next time either. . It is just frustrating to like the food and get the worst service. Ugh.

name: John Graham
text: Limited staff due to COVID-19, but service is STILL Satisfactory 👌

resp.text: John, we’re happy to hear that our team took good care of you! If there is anything we can do to improve your next visit, let us know at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Thanks for stoppin' in🍻

text: gross, gave em a second try still cant cook a steak and its a steak house. name: Heart of Dixie4
text: I always order the baby back ribs, sides, rolls, & a strawberry daiquiri. The ribs are very tender, they just fall off the bone. I'm very picky about my BBQ sauce, but their's has a great flavor. Not too spicy, just a hint of sweetness,and they don't drown your ribs in the sauce, so that you can't taste the meat. The rolls are to die for. I always have to get a dozen to take home with me. The daiquiri is mixed just right for my taste. Very frosty, no overpowering taste of alcohol, but very relaxing, before you know it. Sometimes the service could be a little faster, but I always leave wonderfully miserable from stuffing myself.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to let us know how we are doing. We're thrilled to hear that our baby back ribs and rolls could make your day! Thanks for stoppin’ in 😁

text: If I could give a negative 10 review I would.  And the sad part is the food was great.  The employees were the problem. When I complained to the manager he went over to one of them and spoke to her about wearing the mask.  She had the audacity to just look at him and keep wearing the mask around her neck.  Had she worked for me, she would have gone to the house immediately.  This is why we're going to end up in a shutdown of this country for 3-4 months and a lot of us will end up losing everything we have worked so hard for all these years.  Grow up little girls and boys working in this place and follow the rules. Think of someone else instead of yourself for one time.

text: There steak was cooked just right but for as the wait time it was ridiculous. We have to get a table because my  86 years old adopted  Mother has dementia and down 🔻 n a wheelchair. We looked in all corners and they were available tables everywhere. When the manager did come to our table I told her about our experience and  asked her why this happened and she explained she was short handed with staff and she was swamped with doing to go orders. If someone is in a wheelchair and I can't stand very long and there's no sense in them not offering at least a place that's available to sit until our table was available. I have a bad torn hamstring. If management don't get better we will take our business somewhere else. I will be contacting cooperate office. I have the manager's name's. This is very bad customer service when we are regular customers and my adopted parents drive a long distance. Besides this Logan's the one in Moody is even much worse. We've gave Moody chance after chance. It's poor management at that store. It's ashame I just moved here a year ago and when I first started going and our good experience only lasted maybe 3-4 months now we can't even eat here anymore. It's lousy. Don't do any good to talk to the manager. Moody  Al don't know how too cook a medium rare steak. It's always too tough. I should have sent it back but I didn't. I had to feed it to my patients dog so it didn't go entirely to waste but was still very expensive steak to not get to enjoy. t's time to go to cooperate office with this! name: Petit J
text: Incredibly, today around 12:15 pm I experienced the worst dining experience at any Logan's Roadhouse to date.  There were three factors. Baby Back Ribs were not properly cooked......an ongoing problem at all the locations in the Birmingham area.  I have learned to have a picture on my phone showing the proper preparation when I run into this problem.  As I was politely attempting to explain this issue with manager John Prince, Mr. Prince's attitude was hostile, uncooperative and confrontational. When I asked if he knew how they were supposed to be cooked, he replied, why don't you tell me how they are supposed to be cooked.    At this point I knew I needed to document the conversation and started my phone recorder.  Mr. Prince said I am not going to talk with that recorder on.  I asked Mr. Prince's name and he just stared at me.  I then prepared to leave and Mr. Prince said his name and walked off.  My waitress did a splendid job.  The issue with the ribs is they were pre-cooked as usual, but then they were not finished on the grill.  They were warmed up and BBQ sauce smeared on them. It appears that race may have even been an issue.......I am white and Mr. Prince is black. Mr. Prince never acknowledged the ribs were not properly cooked nor did he offer any apologies or consolation for my dining experience. At approximately 5:15 pm, Logan's District Mgr Charlie Eben called me in response to my complaint.  Mr. Eben assured me that employees would be retrained to insure that proper food preparation would result and the John Prince would also be counseled.  Sorry Mr. Eben!  I have heard promises like that too many times.  It is a roll of the dice no matter how many free meal cards you want to send me.  Your sincerity is in doubt.  There are too many good and quality companies out there with whom I will do business.  Just for the record, I am including a photo of your signature Baby Back Ribs when prepared properly.....and this photo was taken at the Trussville location several years ago when they were doing it right!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate your feedback!
