name: tiffany brown
text: Myself Husband and 4 children came to eat on December 16 around 6:20pm the hostess stated there would be a 15 minute wait, and we agreed to that. 30 minutes went by along with 3 other parties ranging from 3 to 5 people. I asked The hostess how much longer and she said her manager was waiting for a party to finish before she sat us. Another 10 minutes went by and I began to get upset because our placement should not be based on when another family finishes eating. We were about to get up and leave but a server came and got us, told us he was working a big party but he would be more than glad to serve us. Keep in mind the hostess never came by to address us again, nor did any manager. We would probably still be sitting there now if the server who was around the bar area did not offer to wait on us. Now granted I am not an unreasonable person nor am I impatient but the lack of professionalism displayed by the management team was unacceptable. We arrived around 6:20 we were not eating to well over 8:00 pm. I didn't want any discount or free food just the common courtesy to say I'm sorry for your wait and we will get you and your family served as soon as possible, but I guess that was too much to ask for. It will be very unlikely for me to ever Dine at this establishment again.

resp.text: Tiffany, this is not alright with us! We're so sorry that there was a bit of a delay in the food preparation during your last visit.  Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? name: andres hightower
text: Worst dining experience ever and I didn’t even get to eat. I arrived at 9:47 which I know is late however, NOBODY greeted me not the bartender whom was in my view not the waitress at the bar booths there was even a busses whom was walking back and fourth out the door. I started yelling “hello? Can I get some help is there any one here?” Nobody flinched. I sat on top of one of the peanut barrels and waited. Finally the waitress at the bar booths approached me and my friend and asked have we been helped I told her no and we had been waiting for a while and I even had started yelling to get someone’s attention and they never came she then proceeded to take her phone out and look at the time then said “well....what y’all want? I mean I can go get my manager..” so she went to get the manger while I waited on her the busser from before approached us and asked “were you ladies trying to get a table?” I told him the same thing I told the waitress he said “well...that’s because we’re closed” I said no you’re not he laughed and said “oh what is it? 9:59?” I said I didn’t get here at 9:59 though he then told me he didn’t even care because he was off the clock (still in uniform) and walked away...to buss a table. The manager finally approached me and I told her what had been happening and I that I watched her in the kitchen about to walk out look at me and turn around, I informed her that I had managed restaurants including fine dining and this was not how business works she told me she was in the back rolling silverware (even though I saw her) and said she could give me a coupon. I declined and let her know the staff was extremely rude. If I could give this location -5 stars I absolutely would. Horrible.

name: Deborah Woodard
text: When I first walked in the houses seem so confused and out of it she didn't know where to seat me then when she did seat me in an area The Way Church came over and said that this I was closed and he wondered why she seated me there early upon ordering he never offered me water he just went on to bring my salad out with no rose included no napkins are nothing you never came back to see if I was okay I had to ask for napkins but my food came it was about about another very nice waiter and he never came to check on me upon leaving being that it was my birthday I had a coupon for a free dessert he prepared to go and put it in a to-go box and never brought back a paper bag or anything to put it in and just left it on the table and told me have a good day someone behind me said they had the same winner and they were ordering he told them he only had two hands I reported it to the manager who was very nice but as far as going back to that Logan's in Trussville I will never go back it was the food was not good the surface was not good and I would recommend someone else to go somewhere else I could have prepared my own meal at home and been satisfied so they get a zero

text: The food and service.

name: Landon Warrior
text:
The good:  Let me say the "Bacon on a Stick" appetizer was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  It was amazing.  You should stop by just for this appetizer.  I'm not kidding!

The awkward:
Me and my friend from work ate here on July 19, 2018.  Place was slow and the hostess told us that they didn't have a server to help us.  Which was bizarre however a nice young lady named Shelby stepped up and offered to take care of us which she did and I proceeded to give her the maximum tip I could on my company credit card.

The bad:
Friend's steak wasn't cooked correctly.  Kitchen refired it and made it correct.  The other food really didn't stack up to how awesome the appetizer was.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to review your experience, Landon. If you'd like us to follow up with your concerns, please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS. Thank you.

name: Carla White
text:
Ordered my steak med well, got well done, tough, full of fat and veins/something chewy!
Manager came to the table, said he would cook another one. The second steak arrived, cut it open and blood oozed out. Manager said he could put it back on the grill for a few minutes. My party had already finished eating so I declined. I should have asked for my money back but I took it home, thinking I could make it edible. This steak was also full of fat and  veins also. I threw it in the trash. I will never go there again

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great dining experience, Carla. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the store. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: Steak, steak, steak.  The rolls are always a hit.  If you get the ice/cream brownie desert (I think it's Mississippi Mud or something like that)... you better bring a friend.

text: We went here on Christmas Eve and Tracy was our waitress and she was wonderful. Even though they were busy she always came and checked on us regularly and was all around very sweet. We gave her a $15 tip and she gave our 5 yr old $10 of it and told him to buy him something with it. We gave her another tip that she didn't want to take but we got her to take it because she deserved it. Also our son is very shy and when we was getting ready to leave he gave her a hug which he doesn't do to people he doesn't know. I highly recommend this Logan's and Stacy as ur waitress

Last visit I when I came in no one was at the front and I waited 10 minutes. I finally had to call using my cell phone to get the girl up there. Also several employees saw me waiting and no one apparently cared enough to let the girl know I was there I guess. Noticed 4 manager cards on the front desk and wondered why the service is so bad. This could be a great place but you have to get a better staff. And some managers that care

Guess all Logan’s are bad because gadsden is the Same way. Guess when management doesn’t care then staff won’t either. Wish I would have read the other reviews before I wasted my money.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Justin. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: Angela Whitaker
text: My son and I were the second set of customers to walk in the restaurant today, Sunday, as soon as they opened. We were thinking that one of the first orders of the day when it wasn't busy would surely be one of the BEST orders, not completely true. Although my food was ok, my son's wings were fried really hard. He tried to eat them because he doesn't like to complain but I advised him that you should be satisfied with what you pay for. We sent the wings back and told the server that we would pay for the three wings he ate and ordered something else. The manager came out, not to apologize, but to tell us that we didn't need to pay for the three wings. Oh ok, thanks. Guess that was his solution to the problem but then we receive the replacement meal. The replacement meal that we paid full price for and paid extra to get an upgraded side of macaroni and cheese that came in a container that was less than half full. So what do we do? Pay the bill, tip the server her 20%, take the food and leave to not return any time soon until someone in management encourages the kitchen staff to always work hard at sending out quality food. So when you visit, let me know if it has happened. Happy Sunday!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Angela. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: This has to be THE worst run restaurants I've ever eaten at. The food is ok when you get it, but they have no clue how to run it. We got there at 12 PM on a Saturday (peak time) and they had one...One waitress! I can't blame her for the horrible service, because she didnt know if she was coming or going. She was trying to wait about a dozen tables and couldn't remember what food went where.  I could go on on about all the people walking out, but trust me , was a mess. We felt sorry for the poor older lady trying to wait all those tables and still left her a 25% tip, because it wasn't her fault. Poor management.

text: The food was great, our waiter was great, but the hostess unbelievably rude. I asked the hostess to sweep some of the peanuts from underneath, she told me that’s how it was suppose to be and I asked her again and she only half-a__ed swept one side underneath the booth. I literally had to ask for a broom. Again I understand peanuts are supposed to be on the floor but who wants to sit at a booth where you consistently have to keep removing the bulky and sometimes a little sharp peanut shells from the bottom of your feet as you eat.

text: In the beginning we waited for 20 min before someone even came to ask if we needed a table and there was seats open all over the place. I then found out our waitress made my Margarita instead of a licensed bartender, which is why it was way too heavy on the tequila. The waitress also started talking to us about very inappropriate things such as birth control and giving us advice about kids in the future and how we should have never started using money as currency in america. When we found out the check was wrong we told the waitress and she came back and she started complaining about her boss to us, her customers. We stayed there for 2 and a half hours and received very mediocre food. The manager was nice and knew what she was doing, but the staff was very lazy and slow.

name: David Chesser
text:
Decided to try Logans again after the last time that was a complete disaster.

It was better this time but it was still poor. We had to wait over an hour to get seated. Which can be understandable but it wasn't because they were busy. It was because they didn't have enough wait staff there.  Over half of the restaurant was empty. Then they seated four 2 tops before me and my wife and 1 child. Even though we were next in line according to the hostess. I can understand seating 2 tops over 3 because they are busy and that's what's available but they had half of the restaurant empty. There was no reason to adhere to section integrity when tables are open. Then they were out of the steak I ordered and when the steak I chose  was served it was cold.

In the end the food wasn't bad but wasn't worth what I paid or the 2 plus hours we spent there. I have finally learned my lesson and will never ever give them another chance.

We never heard from a manager to explain what was going on. Just a young sweet girl and an overwhelmed waitress.

I've said it before but now it's definitely true. I will never ever eat at any Logan's again anywhere in the country. Pathetic at best. Do not waste your time or money.

name: Amber Burgett
text:
Do not waste your time. Hands down the WORST dining experience I've ever had in my 30 years. The wait wasn't too terribly bad, but after we were seated was terrible.

My roommate, her son, her girlfriend, and I were sat and promptly greeted by our server. We each ordered drinks, and then our food. The salads were pretty good, but then things took a U-turn.

Our food was first brought out to the table next to us. When we brought this to the attention of the server who brought it, he said "Let me go check the ticket." I know from some knowledge shared with me that when that happens, a fresh order is to be made because it touched the table. So the same man finally brings us our food, with the exception of my roommate, which I happen to know is another mistake, as we should have all been served together. I should also note these plates were the same ones as before, which I happen to know because I had a clear line of sight to the kitchen from where we were sitting. This is a health violation.

So after bringing our steaks out, I notice mine is undercooked (I ordered medium and got medium rare). My roommate's girlfriend's steak has been cut into, which is ANOTHER huge no-no. When this was brought to the attention of the man who brought them out (the same man I mentioned before), he claimed that was how it was cooked and acted as if he didn't care when we stuck a knife straight through the pre-existing hole in the middle of the steak.

After the guy walks off, my roommate's girlfriend goes to our server and asks to speak with a manager. Our server points directly at THE GUY WHO HAD BROUGHT US OUR FOOD. You remember him- the rude one. So she asks if there is another manager around. Keep in mind that my roommate still hasn't seen the first morsel of her food. She informs her that the other manager's name is Jennifer and she will be right over. Jennifer was great and went above and beyond to try and turn our visit around. She quickly explains she will check on my roommate's food and bring fresh steaks out to replace the ones we had.

My roommate finally gets her food, and there is cinnamon all over her baked sweet potato- which she specifically ordered without cinnamon. But there is also cinnamon all over her steak- why would the steak have cinnamon on it in the first place? So they bring out a fresh potato, which tastes like it's been sitting out for about 2-3 days before it was brought out to the table.

My roommate's girlfriend and I finally get our fresh steaks, and mine is RARE when I cut into it- worse than before.

We left not having to pay for any of our food, including what my roommate's son ate because his was fine- but I still won't be back. HORRIBLE experience.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your disappointing experience. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with you. Thanks.  Thank you, Timothy. Someone will be in touch.

name: Anissa Ledbetter
text: Took forever to get drinks. Food was ok. One from our party had a hair in there food. One had a loaded baked potato that wasn't loaded! Waitress was okay

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Anissa. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: Jenna Leigh
text: I went with my family last Saturday for a birthday celebration, and the service we got was inexcusably terrible. Let me say I've been to this Logan's many times since it opened, in fact it use to be one of my favorite restaurants in Trussville, but that has definitely changed. We got there a little after 2 PM and had to wait for a table until almost 3 PM. Now, I understand it was a Saturday, so even though it was annoying I was willing to look past it. Once we sat down, we sat there for 45 MINUTES without anyone even acknowledging that we were there. My uncle had to get up and go find someone to even get them to come take our drink order. After finally placing our drink order, it took another 45 minutes to get our drinks...and most of us ordered WATER. Our waitress had a terrible attitude,  we didn't even get our food until almost 5 PM, and once we did get it, it was not good. 3 1/2 hours for what should have been a simple lunch, when most of it was due to sitting around waiting on someone to even acknowledge that we were there is ridiculous. If it hadn't been for my grandmother refusing to leave, we would have left. And then, when my uncle asked about getting a discount, because there was no way we were paying full price for the terrible service, the manager had the nerve to ask "Why do you need a discount?" Even the management didn't seem to care. Needless to say, I will never be back.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great time. We'd like to follow up with you, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

name: Drew Morros
text: Wow, I have had some bad experiences at restaurants but this may be the worst. After waiting over 45 mins to get a table and seeing multiple 2 tops empty we finally got seated. Awesome, not, we sat and waited 10 minutes to have a manager walk by and ask us for drink orders. How freaking hard is it for a server to walk by and say "hey I'm really busy but I'll be back in a couple minutes" if we would have been told this then I would not be leaving this review. The manager (who I will say was extremely busy and did do all she can to handle the situation) then told us "Taylor" will be our server and she should be by any second. Thanks Taylor for never showing up. Probably for the best, we waited another 15 minutes and then decided it was time to leave. We will not be returning to this restaurant or any Logans anytime soon. Save your money and go to Red Robin next door or Rock n Roll Sushi across the street. Or drive to the other side of Birmingham and you may still get your food faster than anyone at this Logans will get their drinks.

name: K Russell
text:
It really saddens me to have to change my review of this place. However, after this pass weekend, they left me no choice. My fiance' and I go to Logan's faithfully, so needless to say, we have spent too much money in this place to be treated the way we were. The service and food quality has really gone down hill. Quite frankly, I can see why they're having to close so many locations now because the competition is better. Granted, all of the other Logan's in this city ARE indeed horrible, but this one was still the best in my book. That is no longer that case!

First of all, we ordered a basket of fried pickles, and we received a half of half basket of fried pickles. I would rather they just told us they were out rather than bring us what they did. We ate those because we were hungry, it was getting late, and we expected a much better dinner than appetizer. It got no better! We waited over 30 minutes for food, and when we got it, most of it was cold as hell. I guess our waitress forgot about it and left it on the counter. My fiance' had meatloaf that was not thoroughly cooked in certain areas, he never got the fries he ordered, so he practically left everything on his plate, he never touched the mashed potatoes and gravy. Our waitress took up our concerns with the manager about our 30-minute wait and the missing items, and as a courtesy she removed 3 whole dollars from our ticket. That was the cost of a side! Gee thanks! You took off what exactly? Our taxes off one of our sides! Then she goes on to explain that they had a party of 35 people come in that they had no idea was coming. That's great, but what the hell does that have to do with us? That's not our problem!! If your business can't serve large parties while maintaining the quality and integrity of your food to all other visitors then you SHOULDN'T be in business... PERIOD!

Basically, we paid full price for horrible food and horrible service. It's sad because we WERE faithful customers, and Logan's just lost us. On top of that, we were not the only people complaining about them when we left. They had people in the waiting area and parking lot who were also not very happy with them.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive feedback! Thanks for reviewing us!

text: Horrible experience. We walked in and the hostess had a look on her face as though she didn’t want to be there and when asked how long it’s like it kills her to give an estimate. She is like that every time we go. So she tells us 15-20 minutes for 2 people when the place is not even close to half full. So we wait instead of leaving....that was wrong on our end. We get sat and the manager comes by to get our drink order gives us rolls and at the time we think everything is good. Some odd time later a woman comes by saying she will be our server as Danny is the manager and she will take our order. We both ordered the 6 oz filet med rare and sides. At least 40 minutes later our meals come out not medium rare and the look and cut of the steak is that of a sirloin. Now we have ate at this location plenty of times and have ordered filets from Logan’s plenty of times. When the server came back we were just ready to go and had wasted a good portion of our day now having to go find lunch elsewhere. I offered to pay for our drinks and my boyfriends salad but the server said not to worry about it. We won’t be returning to this location! Thanks for ruining our Sunday lunch!

name: ira lucas
text: Totally disappointed in my visit, Sunday December 16, 2018. I have eaten here several times and the service has been average, but yesterday was awful. The hostess said it was a 30minute wait to get a table and their were people ahead of me waiting. However she said that if I would sit at the bar that there would be no wait and I would get immediate service. What a misstatement. As I proceeded to the bar, I couldn't help but notice 6 tables empty and wondered why no one had been seated there. Anyway, I sat at the bar and spoke to the gentleman who was seated to the right of me. He said that it had taken 20 minutes for them to take his to go order and that he had been waiting an additional 40 minutes for his prime rib order to come. After about 20 minutes of waiting myself, the bartender/waiter finally brought me a menu. I told him I wasn't expecting to wait an hour for my  food like the gentleman next to me. He said food was coming out in about 30minutes which obviously wasn't happening. Finally the waiter came to take the order of the gentleman on my left side who was with a young boy. He had been waiting over 30 minutes for his order to be taken. He explained to the waiter that he had ordered prime rib on his last visit and was disappointed because there was more fat than meat on his portion.  The waiter told him that the prime rib is usually very fatty and that gives flavor to the meat. I thought to myself that I have eaten prime rib at many places that had little fat and was very meaty, juicy and tender. The bartender/Waiter then suggested that the gentleman order the new York strip. At that moment I changed my mind about ordering the  16 ounce prime rib and decided that I would order the 22 ounce porterhouse,if I could ever get my order taken. By then the poor guy on my right was getting antsy because he had been there over an hour and said that if he had not already paid for his to go order that he would leave. Finally someone else came and asked him what he had ordered since he had been sitting there forever. That  person went to the kitchen and the bartender finally came out about 5 minutes later with the man's order. I thought to myself I hope he has his order right in his bag after that awfully long wait. So now I've been waiting over 35 minutes and still have not had my order taken. So now the bartender waiter guy goes to take someone else's order, bless their soul who was there before me. At that point, I could not take anymore,so I politely got up and told the people around me to have a nice evening and left. I would think that a major franchise as Logan's Roadhouse would provide extra help on busy days like Sunday. I left went to the grocery store and bought a large tbone steak and took it home and cooked it. Oh, also one lady ordered only potato skins to go and said she has been there over 30 minutes. I give yesterday at Logan's a negative -10.

resp.text: Hi, Ira. We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't the best, and we will be looking into this for you. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: ira lucas
text: Totally disappointed in my visit, Sunday December 16, 2018. I have eaten here several times and the service has been average, but yesterday was awful. The hostess said it was a 30minute wait to get a table and their were people ahead of me waiting. However she said that if I would sit at the bar that there would be no wait and I would get immediate service. What a misstatement. As I proceeded to the bar, I couldn't help but notice 6 tables empty and wondered why no one had been seated there. Anyway, I sat at the bar and spoke to the gentleman who was seated to the right of me. He said that it had taken 20 minutes for them to take his to go order and that he had been waiting an additional 40 minutes for his prime rib order to come. After about 20 minutes of waiting myself, the bartender/waiter finally brought me a menu. I told him I wasn't expecting to wait an hour for my  food like the gentleman next to me. He said food was coming out in about 30minutes which obviously wasn't happening. Finally the waiter came to take the order of the gentleman on my left side who was with a young boy. He had been waiting over 30 minutes for his order to be taken. He explained to the waiter that he had ordered prime rib on his last visit and was disappointed because there was more fat than meat on his portion.  The waiter told him that the prime rib is usually very fatty and that gives flavor to the meat. I thought to myself that I have eaten prime rib at many places that had little fat and was very meaty, juicy and tender. The bartender/Waiter then suggested that the gentleman order the new York strip. At that moment I changed my mind about ordering the  16 ounce prime rib and decided that I would order the 22 ounce porterhouse,if I could ever get my order taken. By then the poor guy on my right was getting antsy because he had been there over an hour and said that if he had not already paid for his to go order that he would leave. Finally someone else came and asked him what he had ordered since he had been sitting there forever. That  person went to the kitchen and the bartender finally came out about 5 minutes later with the man's order. I thought to myself I hope he has his order right in his bag after that awfully long wait. So now I've been waiting over 35 minutes and still have not had my order taken. So now the bartender waiter guy goes to take someone else's order, bless their soul who was there before me. At that point, I could not take anymore,so I politely got up and told the people around me to have a nice evening and left. I would think that a major franchise as Logan's Roadhouse would provide extra help on busy days like Sunday. I left went to the grocery store and bought a large tbone steak and took it home and cooked it. Oh, also one lady ordered only potato skins to go and said she has been there over 30 minutes. I give yesterday at Logan's a negative -10.

resp.text: Hi, Ira. We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't the best, and we will be looking into this for you. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

THE FOOD
The food was ok nothing to brag about. We ordered the filet med/rare it was more rare than med/rare but I was ok with that mine had hardly any flavor at all to it. Our potatoes was not quiet done and my salad was ordered with 1000 island dressing which I usually love at Logan's but the dressing here looked like 1000 island but tasted like French.

THE SERVICE
Our waitress was nice and friendly enough. A little hard to catch her attention when I was not real sure if ahe had brought me unsweat tea instead of sweet tea but once we finally got het attention she did everything she could to make it better. So no complaints there.
APPEARANCE
Clean the restrooms needed some attention but once it was relayed to the staff they were made aware of the fact that they needed attention and so I assume that was taken care of.

OVER ALL EXPERIENCE
It wasnt so bad that I wouldn't go back but will make sure to be more specific in my ordering as well as asking questions to make sure my idea of sweet tea and theirs is the same.

text: So, every Wednesday Logans has a special so I bring my 2 kids and we enjoy a meal. The last 2 times we have come it has not been a good experience. Well, then we waited another 5-10 minutes for drinks and rolls. I know it took our door an hr to come out. We were about to walk out. This was not a good experience at all. I ordered a filet, grilled shrimp, broccoli and rice pilaf. The shrimp was cold and the steak was not cooked as I ordered. The brocolli arrived later after I told the waiter jt was missing. My kids did not have their condiments with the food. My daughter didn't even eat hers because she said it was nasty. I will not be returning after this experience.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text:
I have never had luck with big parties at this location. But small groups usually get good service. They still serve peanuts but they don't allow you to put them on the floor anymore.

Ok, so last night Dec 10th 2016 our company went after a 14 hr day to go have a meal. We asked to seat 9 people and sat at the bar to wait for the table. We ordered drinks and kept reminding the staff at the door we were still waiting. After an hr.......yes an hr (not busy and we were told it would be 20min) we finally gave up. The manager acted as if she did not care and the staff made annoying faces when they half tried to clean a table for us. Once again we tried to give them local business, but they failed. 20 min after we left we had a great meal at Olive Garden where the server got a bigger tip from our one ticket that all his other tables all night. A logans server missed out on our ticket.

resp.text: Thank you for the review James, we appreciate your feedback! We would like to know more about your experience. Please send us a private message with your contact info (email address/phone number) so we can follow up with you. Here's a link to our official Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Logans.Roadhouse/. Or, you can send us a PM by clicking on the message button below our cover picture, or you can give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS. Thank you.

name: Ladii Auriel
text: We went on a Saturday evening and the server was great but the supporting staff was horrible. It was 5 of us and my mother received the wrong meal even though, her and my father ordered the exact thing. We had the shaken sweet tea from the bar and fter the initial drink we never got the refill we requested. Then when they bought my mom's plate out, the correct one they grabbed the salmon and sweet potato from the previous plate. I ordered a hamburger which was lukewarm and the bread was soggy. My sweet potato was cold to the touch. We finally got our refill as we were leaving, after I went to the bar and let them know our table was waiting . name: Patrick Haggerty
text:
This was one of the worst experiences ever. Yesterday June 11th my family and I went there for my daughter's birthday dinner. We got seated right away. But then it took 10 minutes before the waitress came to take our drink orders. This was shocking since the restaurant was fairly empty. Also The waitress tried to bring my daughter Coca-Cola  twice when she had sweet tea that was empty . But that is not a big deal. Upon receiving our steaks That's when we were told that what my youngest daughter ordered they did not have. They asked her to re-order while the rest of us had our food in front of us.
I am not the type of parent that will eat in front of my child that has nothing. At that point I asked to speak to the manager. I watched as the waitress went over to the manager and told her I would like to see her. But she did not come right over. It took at least five minutes before she came to see what was going on. I explained what had happened and she did not even apologize. I asked her what we can do at this point. She said she would take our food back and make sure that we all got them served at the same time. It just did not sit right with me that she did not apologize and I had to ask what we can do to fix the situation. At that point I asked her for a check because we were leaving. It was then she just pointed towards the door. Again not apologizing or saying you don't owe anything. Just pointing towards the door. So we walked out and left the food on the table To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I especially felt bad for my daughter who just wanted to eat there on her birthday. Judging by the other reviews and my experience. This location has a serious problem from the management down.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your poor experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

text: Worst experience ever tonight. Food was aweful and the service was even worse. My salad came out with my dinner, my son had to ask 3 times to get water and more bread. My order was wrong and my to go order for my husband came out to me plated. His side salad never came with his order. I waited 20 min for a box to take our nasty food home to give to our dog. When I asked the waitress if she could get my to go side salad as fast as she could (seeing that I already paid for it and I over paid on my bill) there was literally about 3-4 bites of lettuce. My son had practice at 6:00 and it was close to 5:50. Mind you we we got there at 4:45 and ordered right away with our drink order. We were done eating before 5:30. This is a real shame since my son is obsessed with your dinner rolls and we frequently dine there. I will never go back again. I paid for things I didn't get. I don't know if the cook was new but my steak had so much seasoning on it it was barely edible. I scraped as much off as possible. If our waitress would have been more attentive I would have said something. We spent too much of our time seated with no one taking care of us. Even when I said I have to go please give me my receipt to sign, she dropped it off with no pen. Leaving me to have to chase down another waitress to borrow her pen. As horrible as it was our waitress was kind when at our table (twice). We will eat at Logan's again but never again at the Trussville location.

name: Terra Janel
text:
I simply can't believe how poor the service was on Saturday, June 3, 2017!  But now my friend and I look back (2-3 days later) because we're still distraught over our experience, there were several red flags, which started from the moment we walked in to be seated.

1.  When we walked in to be seated there was a customer complaining about there service and how they never received items that they ordered.

2.  The first thing we noticed once seated (which was promptly considering they weren't busy at all) was the table across from us hadn't been cleaned.

3.We sat for about 15 minutes before a server (black male). finally came to our table.  He stands there with his arms crossed speaking abruptly says, "have y'all decided what you you want to order". Without a greeting or introducing himself, we were caught off guard because it felt like he was a drill Sargent commanding us to order our food! We ordered and noticed his arms were still crossed AND noticed he wasn't writing down our order!  It felt as if someone made him come to serve our table.

4.  While we were enjoying our appetizer, which a nice, cheerful young lady brought to us, he returns once to let us know since it was 2:44 p.m., it was too early to put our order into the system because  it's a certain time to order the 2 for $15.99 special, which we understood.

As a result of not writing down our order initially he came back to ask what our orders were again!  Then shortly after that, the initial young lady comes back to ask my friend what his entree was.

5.  Also, while we initially started eating our appetizer, we noticed there were no napkins.  My friend had to get up (while on crutches and wearing a boot) had to go find us napkins!

6.  The entrees were served and the first thing I noticed was my salmon seemed very dry and I thought it was because the oil topping was missing.  I also noticed I received a mushroom skewer, which I'm allergic to mushrooms.  I was supposed to receive the veggie skewer.

7.  The table across from us still hasn't been cleaned, this has been after sitting there over an hour (2:30 - 3:30 at least) looking at it.

8.  After talking to the sweet manager and explaining to her that this could be a training moment for our server(at this point we hadn't started eating to notice the actual condition of our food), by this time,  we're frustrated and ready to leave.

9.  While the female manager was adjusting our ticket to remove the appetizer, I noticed my food wasn't cooked properly.  The sweet potato wasn't cooked all the way through!

My friend has to get up once again, now to request carry out containers because we haven't seen our server lately except from across the room while he was just standing there talking to someone.

The server comes to ask if we need carry out containers.  I explain that my friend just left to go find containers. At this point he realizes hat we can use a refill on our water, which was the best 2nd thing we've had after the appetizer.

10.  The next day (Sunday).my friend takes his dinner to work and realizes his chicken isn't done in the middle!  This is when he and I start to reflect on our overall dining  experience at this location!,

I do not recommend this location, please consider the Fultondale or Crestwood locations, l've only had good service and food from these locations.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

name: Joe LaFerriere
text: Overall the food and service here is good. The steak was cooked to order while the batter on the shrimp was a bit soft and bland. I believe had the cut of the steak been a bit thicker the flavor would have  better and needed less seasoning.

name: Ken Randolph
text: This was one of the best steak dinners that my wife and I have experienced. We've been married 49 yrs. this Sept. 1st. and been everywhere. The server, meal, etc., we're top notch and that's why I didn't hesitate to tip my waiter by 30%+. No more BAD service, and meals, from Longhorn's and Texas Road House. Big, big difference folks!👍👍👍Saltgrass Steakhouse👋👋👋

name: Judy Antonio
text: Our server was great and so was all of our food. Pricey but very good. We were there for lunch on a Tuesday. It was not crowded.

name: Timothy Brown
text: I give it 3 stars because the wait staff are very friendly. As for the food, it seems to be something that you have to have a taste for. I personally didn't like their seasoning combinations but that doesn't make it bad food.

name: Jon Hinds
text: My wife and I enjoyed a delicious ribeye and salmon. Is was perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. We will be back.

name: Anthony Turner
text: Ms. Aurora was the best. On of the most professional waitress I have had in a long time. The food is spectacular. This restaurant is worth every penny and more!!!

name: Shari Harbison
text: The food was awesome and the staff was very friendly. Our waitress was wonderful and checked on us regularly.

name: Joe Tgreat
text:
Six of for dinner on a Friday night as we had a mild 30 minute wait, it was a Friday night so no big deal. The fried mushrooms and jalapeno poppers were perfect.
Our server did a outstanding job of taking care of us and our food was delicious as well. Would I recommend this place?  Absolutely would.

name: Robert Heath
text:
Right off the bat, the place looked amazing. Like a steakhouse should. Rodeo posters from the 80s. Western displays everywhere. Well lit dining areas. All the staff were wearing masks properly.

Our server, Hunter, was amazing! She stopped by our table regularly to make sure we were still having a good time. She kept our drinks full. She even had a bit of small talk with us!

Overall a very good experience that I would gladly repeat!

name: Vanessa Brown
text: The New York Strip was delicious and cooked exactly like I requested. They serve large side portions so make sure to go hungry or prepared to take on leftovers. Our waiter was very nice and great with giving timely refills on drinks. I can't wait to go back!

name: Bridgett Fortenberry
text: I was taken to this place on  my 59 birthday on May 11, 2021 by my cousins. The food & service was absolutely WONDERFUL.  I would recommend this place to everyone.

name: John Wilson
text: My family went on this past Friday night which was busy understood. Our wait was 45 min to an hour. Ended up being longer, because the hostess did a poorly job.  They let a family with the same number come in and go in front of us and when I questioned it the hostess tried to justified  it and said you will be next.  She said oh they are selected members but didn't know their names and gave them our table.  I feel it was something else.

resp.text: Hi John. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: Angela Fuller Grace
text: The Texas T-bone was seared and seasoned to perfection..loaded potatoes and broccoli in cheese sauce were the perfect sides. Truly, I enjoyed this meal.

name: Tina Kay
text: I go here specifically for fried mushrooms & fried shrimp.  The service is always wonderful & they don't mind bringing your to go orders outside to you when it's ready.  I never wait a long time.

name: Tiff Tiff
text: The food was delicious and our waitress was great!

name: LM W.
text: We ordered our food to go and it’s our first time eating here since the pandemic.  It was not the best.  The temperature of the food was room temperature including the soup.  The only thing that was absolutely delicious was the pie.  We use to frequent Saltgrass before Covid, I’m highly disappointed in our food this time.  Might not try again until I’m comfortable with actually dinning in.  We did however go back a few days later and order 3 cheesecakes to go.  They’re expensive but delicious.

resp.text: Hi LM W. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

name: Danitra Manigault
text:
My family and I came to Alabama for the weekend and tried this place because it was near the hotel we were staying at. The parking lot was full so we were sure that this place was going to be awesome. Well it wasn't. the food was just terrible. The rib meat did fall come off the bone but it was soooooo dry and unseasoned. My daughter had a cheeseburger that was ok. My mother in law tried the salmon and herb rice. The salmon actually was good, but the rice was mushy. I ate the loaded potato soup. That wasn't bad. I liked the potato soup but that's all I ate. I don't know what batter the used for the shrimp because that was not good.

The server we had was VERY nice and pleasant. She did give suggestions on what to try, but our palates didn't agree.

name: m chadwick
text: Wow great new place for an expansive nice family steakhouse. The prices are a little more. I will say worth it!! Servers are friendly and efficient. The food is great and not skimpy plates. You will leave full and happy..I am sure. We had a great variety at our table. The appetizers were Rattlers. These things are giant jalapeños with shrimp and cheese battered and fried. When you dip in ranch wonderful!!!! The desserts were pecan bread pudding yum!## There was carrot cake such nice size peices. Also cheese cake. Hoover location is close to the Galleria Mall.

name: Kim Akridge
text: Food was great. Worth the 45 minute wait.

text: I go here specifically for fried mushrooms & fried shrimp.  The service is always wonderful & they don't mind bringing your to go orders outside to you when it's ready.  I never wait a long time.

name: m chadwick
text: Wow great new place for an expansive nice family steakhouse. The prices are a little more. I will say worth it!! Servers are friendly and efficient. The food is great and not skimpy plates. You will leave full and happy..I am sure. We had a great variety at our table. The appetizers were Rattlers. These things are giant jalapeños with shrimp and cheese battered and fried. When you dip in ranch wonderful!!!! The desserts were pecan bread pudding yum!## There was carrot cake such nice size peices. Also cheese cake. Hoover location is close to the Galleria Mall.

name: rod rosser
text: Waitress was Great. Steak fair, taste Great but for medium, I would expect, tender ribeye.

name: T Mathews
text: For the cost, it was underwhelming. My steak was overcooked, shrimp was burnt, they put sweet butter on my baked potato - my salad had old leaves, fried mushrooms were okay, the ranch dressing was the best thing. Wasn't offered a refill and my waitress service was okay.

name: Rod Johnson
text: What a great meal! Order the Maudeen’s Center-Cut Filet medium well with loaded baked potato and asparagus. Steak was seasoned well, asparagus was good too ,so was the mashed potatoes. Order gripe would be the food was not hot. You can tell that food had been sitting before pickup and brought out to me.

text: The wait time keep changing. When we did get in the food was burnt some. Then the bar close. Not very happy after all the good reports I had heard about this place. I could have went anywhere to eat. But after the good reports I be stayed. Not happy.

text: I went to the location in hoover instead of 280, and I was very disappointed.  I ordered a potato soup and the waitress brought it out and it looked thick like mashed potatoes.  I took a chance and bit into it. It was ice cold. It was so disturbing I called out to any waitress to help!  The waitress who helped me was really nice. I'm so glad because I didn't see my waitress for awhile. That's why I have this two stars otherwise it would have been 1 star. The steak was ok and the macaroni was ok. The chef just slappedsome cold soup in a bowl and have it to me. They should do better.

text: Went there on a whim because we were in the area and it wasn't crowded. We got way more than we paid for. Great atmosphere, great servers, and the food was awesome. We had the steak and shrimp, which was cooked perfectly, and then the pecan bread as a dessert. I didn't even know what it was, but I'm glad we tried it. I will definitely be going back.

name: Donna Chancey
text:
The food is just fanTastic! We had aMazing service, 4 people taking care of 3 of us, and one was the Manager! Recommend:
Rattlesnake Rattlers for appetizer, Carrot Cake for dessert! On-site Baker, Y'all!

name: Donnie Turner
text: What a great Steak House!!! Excellent steak,  the rice was very very good. I love blue cheese dressing but the ranch was better. Medium price range,  won't break the bank on a couple date.

name: Amber Terry
text: Saltgrass never disappoints! ❤

name: Mickey Berry
text: We visited here for our office Christmas party and again last night. Our food was top-notch and the service was professional and prompt.  The steak compares well with higher-priced local chains and at about 1/2 the price. I like the atmosphere and the way the management is involved with your experience.

name: Elizabeth Douglas
text: I went for a business dinner and found the food to be decent, but not what I was expecting from a dedicated steakhouse. My steak and shrimp were flavorful but they and the mashed potatoes were barely warm. The bread was good. The atmosphere was a bit cramped, but we did have a large party. I will say our waiter was excellent and very nice - no complaints about the staff whatsoever. I would give it another try, to see if my experience differed from my initial impression. If so, I would definitely adjust my review accordingly.

name: Nicole Haynes
text: I went in and the girl said 45 minutes and took my phone number an hour later I went in to see when we would be seated only to be told I cancelled. Now let me see how was I suppose to do that. I was informed that I got a text when I gave her my number and I cancelled then. Whelp let me just say I have never gotten a text but I was seated only to have a waitress that was working her third double and didn't know where she was, but I can't say that just about her. We sat and watched staff come from the kitchen wnd try to find the right table food went to. We watched peoples order just get left off and just not right at all. All this for just ok food. Not again

name: Jolene Douglas
text: This is my first ever bad review- Don’t bother making a reservation. The establishment states that they will seat you before walk ins, but in our situation no table was available at the reserved time (we did arrive 5 minutes prior). I called 15 minutes before they closed (45 minutes after our reserved time), and was offered a table by a manager, but was told there would still be a wait by the host. As a former restaurant host, I know the staff dread of taking a last minute before close table- that is the mark of a rude inconsiderate customer.  We may have dodge bad food according to other reviews. I should have waited until they closed to see if they’d bother paging us or letting us know they were closing and could not serve us.

resp.text: Hi Jolene. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

text: Steak was amazing! Worth every penny.

name: Stacey Wade
text: On March 16th, 2021 around 2:30ish me and my mom stopped to have lunch here we have ate here previously several times and the food was good . I ordered a baked potato. macaroni and a salad * I don't eat meat* my mom ordered the baby back rib plate . The waitress came out and said they was out of ribs so my mom ordered the chicken without the gravy with a baked potato. Both baked potatoes cold, macaroni cold, chicken tasted burnt and the bread we waited on forever didn't get it until after our meal arrived was cold although she said it was right out of the oven! We ask for the manager he did come to the table to ask could he make it over but we had somewhere else to be so really didn't have time for him to remake what we already waited on, he did take them items off the ticket but made us pay for a salad I didn't eat and a sweet tea I didn't drink . The worst part is they was not even busy!!  Maybe us and 3 more tables Bad service and Food was cold.  Never Again! Very disappointed this time !

text: I was very pleased!! This was my first time eating here and I must say everything was delicious 😋. I can see myself eating at this establishment again!

text:
res·er·va·tion
/ˌrezərˈvāSH(ə)n/

the action of reserving something.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: This restaurant is like your upscale steakhouse. The menu is normal, but the prices are outrageous. The atmosphere was good, but the restaurant stays crowded and causes a lot of traffic. The food was okay and no special garnishment or appearance than your regular steak house. Actually Logan's has a b ettet appearance in plating the food. I ordered a mesquite grilled chicken breast, garlic mashed potatoes and a salad. The chicken was a normal size and had the grill marks on the chicken. The garlic potatoes were prepared the regular way. The salad was good, however they add the dressing to it. It would be best to have the customer apply the dressing so they can gauge it to their taste. I attended for a birthday dinner and the waitresses were really good and polite. I enjoyed the fellowship, but the food was nothing special. I think I will stick with Logan's.

name: Summer Wise
text: Delicious food, nice environment, friendly staff. We really enjoyed our first time dining here!

name: Stephen Carlee
text: Real nice service awesome food just a great place to eat just awesome service a real nice waiter

name: El Erby
text: Awesome service and food. Will visit soon.

name: Ryan Mclain
text: Awsome my favorite  place love the atmosphere

name: Kari Osborne
text:
Overall, everyone's food was good, and we certainly appreciated the effort the restaurant put forth to ensure a safe distance between tables. Based on the food, we would go back again.  The reason for the rating is specific to the following:

While the restaurant had a notice posted to the door requiring patrons wear a face mask while inside the building until they reached their table (in compliance with local ordinances), the host really showed no authority in enforcing that policy.  Specifically, a couple sat down in the waiting area and refused to wear the mask they had in their hands or even distance themselves from others not in their party.  Unfortunately, the host did not attempt to reinforce their policy or even get someone that could.

Regardless of any actual benefit of wearing a mask, the lack of discretion in enforcing the ordinances they are bound to uphold in order to reopen is concerning.

name: Kisha Davis
text: Never show up on a Saturday night unless you have reservations!

name: Kevin Cosma
text: Very good service, and exceptional food. A bit pricey, but you'll know that going in

name: Kyra Harris
text: I went here for the first time on a whim, and was kinda disappointed honestly. For a steak house, they didn’t cook my steak right. They agreed it was wrong and took it back and redid it, came back and it delicious. But they also forgot the grilled onions that they offered to put on, so there’s that...The quality was great however, still could’ve been cooked a little more but I was just starving at that point so I took it as is. The bread wasn’t anything fancy and their sweet butter was okay too.

resp.text:
Hi Kyra. We sincerely apologize for your recent experience. We are always looking for ways to improve and would appreciate any feedback you would be willing to provide at the link below.
http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

text: Great food, welcoming atmosphere and friendly service. A friend and I met for dinner at Saltgrass in Hoover last month. We ate at the bar. The  bartender, Jordon, greeted us as soon as we walked up, handed us menus and took our drink orders. I had a glass of wine and the salmon entree. The salmon was perfect! Jordon was very friendly and attentive. We will be back!!

name: Betsy
text: I showed up starving. They were so busy. I parked in a takeout spot and dialed the number. I'd never seen the menu. I told the gal my steak wishes and my budget. I hardly knew I'd hung up the phone before a masked and friendly gal handed me a sack at my car. Sure. You can take and fill orders all day. The steak? Like butter. Where you snap fingers and wave in the chef for kudos, because your mouth is too full to talk, then you remember you're not a mob boss, and that you just got Saltgrass steak, carryout.

name: Larry Dearman
text: The steaks were good and they were the way we ordered them.Potato was hot.The only thing was the tomato's in our salad, they were a little to ripe, but the salad was good.

text: Saltgrass never disappoints! ❤

name: Stephanie Lewis
text: Loved this place ,the people was nice and the food was great

name: Haynes Mobile Notary & Wedding Services LLC
text: I took my 6 yr old grand daughter to Saltgrass 12/28/19.  The wait for a table wasn't too long.  The food was average and the service wasn't too bad either.  My server was nice and he tried his best but.... he never brought our salad.  The ribs were not fall off the bone tender.  The chips for my spinach dip were a little too done for my taste.  The server said they would comp those because he said they had not changed the grease the chips were friend in but they never did.  Instead they came back and told me there was nothing wrong with the chips.  They said the chips were dark because the chips were corn chips and not flour chips.  I ordered steak fries and instead I was given diced potatoes and they too were dark as though they were cooked in "Old oil".  The server was supposed to bring us to go cups and never did.  I called back once I got home to speak to the manager (as they were very busy while I was there and I didn't want to cause anyone else to have the issues I had) I spoke to the manager and all she offered me was a free salad the next time I come in.  I asked her if I get a side salad with my meal why would I want 2 salads... She then offered me a free salad if I should be coming through town and wanted to stop in and pick it up.  Chances are great I will not be back to Saltgrass.  I paid over $50 plus a tip for a meal for a 6 year old and myself and I received a comedy of errors and average food and all I was offered was a free side salad with my next meal (that comes with a side salad).

name: D.L Belvin
text: Definitely worth it! Best steaks and Carla was an Awesome server! Homemade carrot cake the size of Montana...yummy!

name: Bailey Randolph
text: Chicken fried steak was about 2-3 meals worth and amazing. The whole family enjoyed the food and our waitress Ebony (I believe that's her name) was delightful, attentive, and quick. All in all it was a lovely experience and we will be returning!

name: Brittani Shelton
text:
My husband and I went for our anniversary on Saturday night. The wait was only about 15 minutes, despite them not accepting reservations. The food was excellent, cooked exactly how we ordered it. The bread was tasty and not burnt tasting like other steak houses.

We ordered the Queso Fresco with braised brisket and it was delicious! I ordered Maudeen's Center Cut Filet with loaded garlic mashed potatoes and it was one of the best steaks I've had. Anouska was a great server. She catered to our needs even to the point of adjusting our plates/appetizers to ensure we had ample room on our table.

I highly recommend it. We have a new favorite restaurant!

name: Chris Smith
text: I loved the service the food was great. My wife and I steak were awesome perfectly cook and seasoned. I ordered med rare and she ordered med well. The bread u get it ok but the butter was delicious. Salads that came with steaks were big size and we love d the croutons that came in them tasted house make. Over was great. My advice be careful with shrimp cocktail made me sick for some reason (I don't have food allergies) I eat shrimp all the Time. But great place to eat tho

name: Lauren Crandall
text:
This place truely does not live up to the hype. We waited an hour and a half for a table. It was nice that they did texting so we were able to go across to shop and walk around while we waited.
We ordered the loaded fries, which were not fries. They are potato bites, which was fine and they were really good! My companion and I both ordered steak and shrimp items and were both very dissatisfied. The steaks were COVERED in pepper. You couldn't even enjoy the flavor of the steak through the pepper, mine was also over cooked. My shrimp was good though so that was a plus. The Mac and cheese was flavorless though.
The service was sub par. You could tell the servers were swamped and ours literally ran away from our table when she took our drink orders. I don't blame her at all since I know how hard it is to manage a large section. Every interaction with her was super short and cut off by her walking away. When she came to check on our food after we got it she barely stopped. I didn't even bother to tell her we didn't like it because we had already waited over 2 hours for the table then food.
All in all we may go back in a few months, but it wasn't anything special. After seeing all the hype about it I was very let down.

name: Dennis Lathem
text: We visited the Hoover location on a Monday night with a party of 4.  Seating was quick as was the server.  The menu was varied and our party had chicken, salmon, steak and pork chop entrees.  Service was very good and everyone enjoyed their meals.  I am pleased we have another good restaurant choice in our area.  I will defiantly be back for more.

We both had steak his was the New York strip which he said was one of the best steaks he ever had and the wedge salad which he loved. I had the center cut filet which cut like butter.
Most definitely going back again soon!

name: Bonnie Morris House
text: I don’t usually give 5 stars, but I don’t think I’ve ever been more impressed with a steakhouse as I was tonight at Saltgrass Steakhouse. From the moment they opened the door for my family it was a 5 star experience. We were seated quickly and the waitress, Kelly, was awesome! She was very knowledgeable of the menu as this was our first time dining there so we asked a few questions before ordering. She timed our food just right so that we were never left waiting on the next course. The food was excellent! In fact, I told my husband that it was quite possibly the best flavored steak I’d ever had. To top off the excellent evening, they held the door open for us on the way out! We will definitely be eating here again!

name: Jackson Hart
text: My family came to this restaurant on father’s day. Because of the pandemic, the had limited seating available for our family of 6. Instead of telling us that at the door, they lied to us about the wait time (they said it was 25-30 minutes), and let us sit there for an hour while multiple parties entered in front of us. Then after one hour they finally let us know that they could seat us at 2 different tables across the restaurant. We finally decided to leave after that. Terrible service. Would only recommend this place to people I want to suffer.

resp.text: Hi Jackson. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Would you please follow the link below to provide us with just a few more pieces of info? We would like to look into these issues further. Thank you. http://www.bit.ly/landrysfeedback

text: I was skeptical about this place at first. I figured it would be another lousy chain restaurant with overpriced food and drink. But boy was I wrong! I never order steak when I go out because they are usually bland. This one had just the right amount of seasoning and char on it. Definitely will be back again 👍

text: Had a great time with family. This night was great being we beat the rush by calling ahead to get on the list. Service was great even though they were completely packed out! For great steak and fun atmosphere check them out!

name: alyssa holloway
text: My family and I went to Saltgrass yesterday and had an amazing time! All the staff treated us like family and checked on us consistently to make sure everything was good to go at our table. The food is absolutely amazing! I had the bone in ribeye and loaded mashed potatoes! The food and staff makes for a remarkable experience! Great job!!!!

name: Jerry Seals
text: Great feel of a good ole fashion steakhouse

text: Just not a good experience

name: John Anderson
text: Staff was nice and the food was excellent.

name: Valencia Moore
text: I had a get time today.  My sister and myself enjoyed a 12 oz.tee bone steak.  It was cooked just right.  Atmosphere was great.  You can go dressed or casual.  We were casual. Food server was very attentive.

name: Anna Hart
text: I’m not sure how I can give one star to our experience today but the system doesn’t allow for a zero star rating.  It did smell nice in the waiting area but that is as far as we got.  We gave our names to the host requesting a table of 6 and were told that it would be a 25 minute wait at 12:15.  The app said that we were the next table at the 12:45 minute mark.  At 1:05, we were still sitting at the entrance watching the host sending consecutive snapchats from his phone.  My husband complained to an employee who quickly explained to him that seating wasn’t her job.  I think he might have been talking loud enough that someone alerted another employee who came to talk to us but did not introduce herself.  She informed us that she was unable to seat a table of six due to Covid19 restrictions but could seat 5 of us at one table and 2 of us at another across the restaurant from each other. Considering that it was Fathers Day, we didn’t feel that was a feasible option for our family so we left.  We were offered no other option.  She never apologized or Indicated that she felt bad that we had waited almost an hour and could not sit together.   As we walked out, she sarcastically said, “Have a nice dinner”.  We ate fast food for Father’s Day this year at 2:00 pm.  Thank you, saltgrass, for teaching my kids what customer service should never look like.

name: Judy Bearden
text: Enjoyed s great steak, the entire meal was wonderful. The service was also very good. The steak was cooked to perfection. Will go back

text: We had an awesome  in this place. We enjoyed the awesome atmosphere and the food. The staff members are very attentive. I’m content we ultimately managed to visit this place.
