name: Subie Chik
text: The new renovations are nice, but they did not add enough parking for the dine-in customers, so people have to park at the drive in ordering boxes to go inside & order. The staff was very uninformed on the menu & what options they no longer carried. We went in & I ordered a family size tot for my family & it showed on the ordering screen "family tot" with the appropriate price. I paid at the order box & our food came out quickly, but in a smaller bag than we were expecting. I asked the waitress about the family order of tots & she said it wasn't an option & so she gave me a large size order. Instead of asking if I would like a refund or a different size tot, she said she would ask her manager about it. She came back about 30 seconds later & said the manager refunded the difference & she walked off before I could say another word. I feel the waitress & manager were extremely rude for not properly informing us & giving us an option for something different. I never even saw the manager since the interior "eat in" area is just like ordering outside in your car. The staff needs better training & the store needs a better manager instead of the one they have! They need a manager who acts like a manager instead of hiding behind wall & making the food runners do his work for him. The manager should have personally come out to explain the situation to us & try to remedy the problem! We will not be back!

text: I love the renovation and my milkshake was great! Sadly the customer service was subpar as there way drama in the parking lot between associates and a group if kids. I wont lower my review because I know they mean well, but it was very disappointing and not professional at all. Hope you guys get your wet floor sign back.

INCONSISTENT!  So good last month but ordered chicken sandwiches tonight that were horrible!  Chicken and bun only!  No mayo, lettuce, tomato or brioche bun!  Chicken left a very unpleasant film in my mouth with the one bite I tried!  It’s “states” on the menu that the sandwich includes mayo on brioche bun.  Last month it looked exactly like the pic on the menu.
The young man that delivered was very pleasant and he got the star!

name: Kelsey
text: The new app has been pushed lately. It worked wonderfully the first 3 uses. It gave errors the most recent time, the store didn't help. The amount in the app can't be used at the store like other businesses can allow for payment. There's no live support if the app malfunctions. They refuse to refund the money on the app. Not customer friendly at all. Don't use the app! The customer isn't valued here. The app is just a way to take money without providing a service. The site doesn't even stand behind the app. Beware folks!

text:
Pelham Sonic drive-in
I love it. It is convenient to where I live and shop. I only get the Bacon, egg & cheese toaster. I'm cheating on my diet, but I don't go but about twice a month, if that much. I usually go when I've skipped a meal & I'm starving. Sonics usually have specials at least once a week if not more often. I use to get the cheese burger special & split it with my Mom before she passed. Once you place your order, service is quick & friendly.

name: May Gardner
text: I have never had such prompt and friendly service at a Sonic in my life. While the service is always fast at this location, Mariah (our carhop) went above and beyond. She was extremely personable and brought us the extra condiments we requested quickly and with a genuine, happy attitude. The food was excellent and modified exactly as we'd ordered. It was a refreshing change for a trip to a fast food establishment to be an enjoyable experience. Thank you so much! 10/10 would recommend

name: Kendyl Webb
text: Came for the 99 cents mozzarella sticks promotion and they had ran out of mozzarella sticks. We had attempted to order 4 orders. They stated that they would give us a voucher for future use (it had 4 written on it). When we came to redeem our voucher they tried to refuse to honor it. Then they said we could have one order.. then after we explained the situation the lady said, "we can do it only this time". We said okay and we're fine with that. They then only rung up 2 orders and said they could only do two for now that we could get the others "another time". But then they wouldn't give vouchers for the other two. They said their manager is on vacation and they would have to ask him when he got back. The cashier denied ever saying that they could do it this time. After about 15 minutes they finally agreed to honor their voucher. Also ordered a chicken sandwich with no mayo and no tomato.. this was discussed three times and my sandwich still had tomato. According to the receipt the cashier's name was Samantha. I will not be back to this location. Very dissatisfied.

text: Foosackly's is new to us, and we've tried it a few times now. The food is okay. The chicken tenders are tasty but small. The fries are dry and bland and really don't care for the coleslaw which is usually my favorite item at my of these type of places. I will admit the sauces are exceptionally good, and worth the trip just for those. And the prices are great!

name: Josh Wayland
text: What an excellent experience. One of, if not the best, chicken restaurants my family has ever been to. The employees were friendly and helpful, the place was clean, and the food was just excellent. We stopped here on our way to Florida from Oklahoma and makes me wish we had one. Amazing sauces, delicious fries, and wonderful chicken. You won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write us this glowing review!

name: Eric Bull
text: Kinda like Zaxby’s but a better selection of sauces.

name: Oscar A
text: It was my very first time going there. My experience was great! I had the worker who was taking the orders outside help me out with deciding on what to get. She also gave almost every sauce they had to try with my meal. Their chicken tenders were criosy but soft enough where you wouldn't scratch the roof of your mouth.  Needless to say I had more than enough to eat. The employees were helpful and friendly. I only wished they added a bit more cheese on their cheese fries.

resp.text: Thank you Oscar for sharing your experience at Daphne Foosackly’s!!!

name: Rebecca Ellsworth
text: They are normally awesome with our order. My husband always calls our order in and I go get it and everything is there and good but this time they could not find his order under our last name so they gave me the wrong order and I paid for it. But the other girl seen she charged us for someone else's order that was supposed to be picked up the next day so they found our order but everything was not there so I had them fix it and charged correctly then they forgot my dressing were supposed to be pints so they had to get them right and then I had to pay again. I think they were alittle off tonight. I will go back though because we enjoy their food.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that we did not live up to what you normally expect from us.  If you could send us a direct message with all the details so we can see where we went wrong with our service and hopefully find a way to make up for your last experience.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

name: J Atterberry
text: I was at Foosackley’s today 11/23/20 between 4:00 / 4:30 pm I order a Snack toast , slaw , 3 chicken strips  . As I was eating my slaw there was a long hair in my slaw I could not eat the rest of my food . Usually the food is good but sometimes lately the order aren’t always right .and the traffic getting in there is overwhelming. Ppl don’t know how to drive and the they r very rude that is the customers in the drive through. Although I do love Foosackley’s  it will take me awhile to go back .  I have a picture of the hairs but couldn’t up load it to the website .

resp.text:
Hey there,

We’ve very sorry about the experience you’ve had. We are doing our best with the traffic, but to the other things we have to apologize. That’s no good. We’d love to make it up to you if you’d allow us. If you would like to continue this conversation please reach out to us at daphne@foosacklys.net so that we can collect more information. Please address to management.

Thank you for reaching out.

name: LeAnna Burt
text: Took forever for a to go order. All the workers were literally huddled together.

resp.text:
LeAnna, sorry to hear about your wait and thank you for bringing this to our attention.  We are currently talking to the crew about this feedback and assure you that we take it very seriously.  If there is anything we can do to remedy this particular situation you can reach us directly at daphne@foosacklys.net or calling us at 251-375-1104.  We appreciate your business and hope that you can give Foo another chance.

-Foo Management

name: Beer Ski
text: Always love swinging through the "Foo" wish we had one in Cape Coral FL

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Trevor DeBlaey
text: I love eating here I really do ,but the last time I ate in store a roach crawled across the table and crawled on my plate freaked me out a bit had to abandon half a plate of food. Other than that it was a good experience ,but obviously being clean is number 1 right now . Would be 5 star if there was no bug problem.

resp.text: That is terrible!  Cleanliness is always a top priority.  We will have our exterminator in right away.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  I assure you this is an isolated event and hope it doesn’t turn you away from trying us again in the future.

name: Eric Turrentine
text: I do t understand everyone's obsession! It's okay food and super cheap. The reason for 4 stars is because it's so cheap.

name: Isabelle Moseley
text: I eat here probably too much, whatever. I love this place. That being said, after some menu analyzation, I have a question! As a sauce-a-holic, this is taking up a bigger portion of my brain than I care to admit. The snack and bigger snack have 2 and 3 tenders respectively, and get only one sauce each. Cool, fine. The salad has 4 tenders and gets 3 sauces. The bigger box has 7 tenders and gets 3 sauces. So, I’m just wondering why the box with 5 tenders only gets 1 sauce instead of 2 or even 3. It’s okay, I pay my $.29 and move on. But it just upsets me a little and I’m hoping in my lifetime, this most important qualm of mine will be solved. Whatever, I’ll still be in the drive through ordering my three sauces with a pint to-go.

resp.text: Thanks Isabelle!  When we opened 20 years ago there was no Snack or Bigger box..only a Box with 1 house made sauce.  When we made changes and added a Bigger box we added the bonus sauces.  When we added the smaller meals we really couldn't give less than 1 so we included 1.  Not a great answer we know but it's the answer.  Some our sauces we lose money on at .29 fwiw and we spend a great deal of time making and pouring them each day which is why we need to charge a little bit for them.  Glad you enjoy them and hope you think they are worth it.  thanks again for the question and your business!

resp.text: Thanks Stephanie. We saw your photos. That’s great. Come back to see us when you’re back this way!

Drive-thru was SO quick, the line was super long (its big-time popular), great prices and a simple menu. The chicken was juicy and the coating was super light, but perfectly crunchy!! The sauces are FANTASTIC ... LOVED  the Foo sauce, sweet and spicy kung foo is a must try for a zippy licking flavor and honey mustard was ridiculously tasty and sweet. PLEASE STOP HERE if you are traveling on hwy 10, you wont regret it this local favorite! 🤩

The fries are also definitely better than most other fast food places, and the prices are very fair. Service was on point, no complaints here.

text: I am a new Foo fan. I had never heard of Foosackly's before I moved to Alabama and I passed this wonderful establishment every day unaware of what I was missing. My eyes were opened when the company I work for had catering from Foosackly's. Wow! The chicken is so tender and flavorful. Even the fries are good. After being turned-off by the changes made at a similar chicken joint down the road, I was so happy to finally find tasty, good quality chicken. When I visited for the first time, the restaurant was so clean and the staff was very upbeat and friendly. I loved it, and the prices! I have gone here at least 6 times over the past few months and I'm in love. There is always a line around the building at dinner time but, trust me, it moves fast and it's worth the wait. I only wish I could give them six stars.

A very pretty town.

text: Every time I go here they mess up my order. The food is good but I'm not feeling the staff ar all

resp.text: Hey, tough feedback. It’ll help us get better. We’re sorry that we are messing up those orders and would like to try to make up for it. Would you mind reaching out to daphne@foosacklys.net so that we can collect a little more information from you? You can address the E-mail to Lance. Thanks again for reaching out.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Seth, we try to keep it simple!

text: We never heard about this place before because we are on vacation from Louisiana. OMG!!! Puts Canes to shame. Long lines, but worth the wait. I would wait twice as long for some more!!!

name: Judson Meherg
text: It's Foosacklys so I love it! Service is quick and the staff is nice. They have a very light crispy breading on their chicken that sets them apart. They only do chicken and they do it well! The location is clean with ample seating indoors with a covered patio with seating as well.

name: Christina Yeakel
text: This location of the local chicken tender vendor (see what I did there) stands up well to the original in Mobile.  Prompt service,  clean inside and out,  and hit tasty food.  I'm subtracting one star,  and this might be unwarranted,  but it seems that they have made the tender portions a bit smaller than they used to be.  If I could take just a half star,  I would,  but I cannot. Other than that,  you really can't go wrong with this place. From their home brewed sauces to their post meal clean up service (unheard-of in this segment), the only thing you have to lose by not eating here is the money you take up the road to the other guys.

name: Chris Manning
text: Service is always prompt and polite, food is always fresh tasting.

name: Razgriz Surget
text: The food is good, but the practice of throwing away the customer's food for them is quite flawed. It seems like a courtesy on paper but on my most recent visit I got up to refill my cup and by the time I had walked back to my table the girl had thrown my food away. Which it really isn't her fault, she was just doing what she was told to do. However, it led to almost half a plate of food getting thrown out for literally no reason. It honestly upset me more that the food got wasted than not being able to finish my meal so I just walked out. I hope the management sees this and changes this practice.

name: Jessica Allen
text:
The drive through system at this location is the worst design I've ever seen! Wrap around the building twice just to order?! Merging twice in a drive through?!
I've been to many different Chick Fil A's in many different states. I've been to busy locations in cities multiple times larger than Daphne.
Never again will I even attempt this location.

name: Super Mom Cooley
text: I shared this on my personal page but also wanted to give kudos here. I tell you what....Chic Fila has it going on. They should train ALL fast food restaurants!!! The line was wrapped around the building THREE TIMES. They had FOUR people in the RAIN serving the guest to keep the line moving. I got in line at 7:54 and had my food at 8:11. That is 17 min for about 50 cars. It would take other FF places that long to serve 5. They are COMMITTED TO EXCELLENCE and do it with a smile and friendly. Good job chic Fila! These girls need a RAISE!

name: Jan Serrano
text: I love Chick-fil-A and always go to this location. The food is good and hot most of the time but sometimes they don’t give you everything. Very nice employees when I do curbside pickup. The delivery service I didn’t really like they take a long time to come and the girl didn’t even knock or anything to let me know she brought the food. If I wouldn’t have checked my phone I wouldn’t have known.

name: Phyllis Jones
text: First visit to this location. Pleasant experience! Tried the grilled spicy chicken. It was ok. I think I'm just tired of fast food.

name: Crystal Osborn
text: The only place where the salad still tastes good even when they forgot to give you your dressing and toppings.

name: ArkanShadowFox H.E.B.
text: Our food was not really up to par. First, my sister's salad was missing its avocado ranch, and my food was not great. My fries were over salted and chicken was burnt tasting on the outside.

name: Jennifer Northcutt
text: Service is super fast,even when the line is wrapped around the building! Don't let the long lines fool, it's really only about a 7-10 min wait. Staff is always in good spirits!

name: David and Diana George
text: We ordered on the app and showed up at the appointed time to pick up our food.  We parked in the place where we were instructed to park.  We waited 20 minutes for the food.  I finally had to get out of the car and flag down an employee.  5 minutes later, our food showed up.  No apology, no explanation.  We have been to other Chick-fil-A's and always received great service.  This one is an anomaly.  I don't recommend visiting this location.

name: Wyatt Brackin
text: They show up every morning about 430 to prep there food for quality and prep their minds for achieving greatness

name: L0RD CRONUS
text: So.. the drive through line is very very long around noon. Not their fault but still something to be aware of when coming to this location. Somehow with the drive through and the pick up curbside they still manage to be reasonable quick. By quick I mean it only took me 30 minutes to get in line, order and leave. Other franchises I'm sure it would if taken way longer. Food was very hot and fresh when I picked it up, stage was very friendly and organized for the amount of traffic they had. Very happy with my visit, I recommend going here when it's not as busy, but if you go at lunchtime you pretty much know the deal.

name: fancy ness
text: Very kind staff! Never had issues in the past. Amazing Food hot, fresh, and fast!!!

If I ate burgers, I wouldn't have gone there today. The sandwich, when I finally got it, was good. Dauphin street in Mobile did much better on service last Saturday!

The last time I ordered Macaroni  for grand son and guess what nothing to eat it with. Is it my resonsibility to make sure everything is in bag or theirs while using drive thru?

text:
Fast , efficent, service and order is Always correct.  Many other fast food resturants should learn how to do the same.  Long lines move very fast. Cudos to Chick-fil-A.
Christians make a big difference serving others.  We love the food and excellent service.  Jesus is Lord!

text: I just went to the Chick-fil-A in Daphne on highway 98 and I ordered a chicken biscuit and two cookies and they didn't have no cookies made I am so disappointed why don't you have cookies made they should be fresh from the morning it is 9:22 in the morning here and Daphne Alabama now I have to go to a totally different Chick-fil-A because I want cookies from Chick-fil-A I'm upset

text: This is the third time straight they have shorted me on my order. The last two times have been my 3 year old’s Mac and cheese. So when we get home she has nothing. We love chick-fil-a and what they stand for but this location is a disappointment. I doubt we patronize it again.

name: Lynn Drake
text: I sat in my car in line for over 20 minutes at 10:15 this morning.  I bought minis and the bread tasted like it may have been fresh yesterday and the meat inside was teeny tiny.  Where's the chicken?

name: Billy Lawson (Windshield)
text: Quick service for so many people.

name: mazie ikner
text: Great food great service

name: Lawrencia Ratcliff
text: They are always very nice even with the line wrapped around the building

name: Emily Nixon
text: I love CFA & have only had a handful of bad experiences. But today, i sat in the curbside pickup area for 20 minutes waiting on my food (which was only two bowls). I got the notification saying the food was ready. And continued to sit and wait. I had an appointment, so I no longer had the time to wait. I called the restaurant & asked them what was going on & the girl on the phone told me it would be out shortly... it wasn’t. I called again and just asked her to cancel it because I had to go to my appointment. She told someone in the background to take it to me. And I told her I was already on the way out and she just hung up on me mid-sentence. Like I said, I love CFA & usually service is great. But the girl on the phone was so rude today and they seemed the need a couple more employees.

name: Charlie Dantin
text: First time I got a salad there it wasn't made like they make the salads at chick fil a innspanish fort by the mall other than that it was ok an i wasnt given the salad dressing i asked for

name: Court Lane
text: I have NEVER had a bad experience until tonight! The lady at the window gave me a bag and I watched her take the bag back from the car in front. After asking for a new order she became rude. I even told her I ordered the whole entire meal but was only given the sandwich and lemonade. As much as I love Chick-fil-A this will be my absolute last time buying or supporting them.

name: Todd Smith
text: Absolute angels out in the South Alabama heat helping ne indulge my fried chicken sandwich fantasies. The dizzying loops around the store to get in line for the drive thru can throw you off but once you get your fried delights, all is mended. Roll Tide and keep your distance out there!

text: I usually go to chick-fil-a weekly, but this is the worst one I've been to. I ordered curbside, and I waited for nearly 30 minutes as I watched cars go by in the drive-thru. Once my food came, I did not have a straw, fork, napkins, or sauce. Disappointed.

name: Jeff Gardner
text: Like other locations, it is clean and well-maintained, and their staff is professional and still welcoming and friendly.  They assisted those in our party who are disabled, and the older patrons with a smile.  Plus, the Grilled Chicken Nuggets were done perfectly, and delicious.

name: Santyonia Bradley
text: Love their nuggets 😍

name: Tonya Floyd
text: Perfect, and delicious as always. Orders were perfect, zero mistakes. Fresh food. Fresh lettuce on the sandwiches. The employees are ALWAYS at one hundred percent...... efficient, and polite, and absolutely everyone always has a big beautiful smile on their faces. An impeccable fast food restaurant. 🤗

name: KALIE SWISHER
text: Customer Service is top notch at this location. Eric was such a delight in taking care of my order today. Would highly recommend this location to anyone.

name: P Tomas
text: Consistent from property to property. Great customer service. Good consistent product. I am always amazed at the fantastic attitude of the employees/team members. My big gripe with the restaurants is that they are too successful. No matter how hard they try, and I believe they do try their very best, the drive-through is always packed. They need to put in four lanes.

name: A_Desiree E
text: The most friendliest place! And the chicken,..the best!!!

name: Carol Taylor
text: Chick-fil-A in Daphne Alabama is always great! The service is fast and your order is correct. The people who work there are courteous and very helpful!

name: Lawrence Barry
text: Super clean place. Great service. The only issue was the FOOD! After returning our chicken (We each ordered the four piece meal), which was hard as a brick and looked as if had been under the heat lamp for several hours, we were promptly returned what were supposed to be "fresh" filets. Alas, they were just as tough and as old as the ones before.

name: Suzie Sheffield
text: Nice to take the grandchildren to play here When the weather's not cooperating. And a good place to eat and socialize.

name: Deb Abbott
text:
Frustrating....so, I’m in the drive through, they’re not very busy...employees talking in a group not paying attention! A young man finally comes to my vehicle and I’m placing my order with him and he says, you mean you haven’t ordered.....duh.....he tells me I have to circle the building and place my order to another employee and then he can take my money......so, I drive around the building & there are 5 cars ahead of me...  seriously....didn’t even apologize.....
😔😔😔😔☹️☹️☹️

I ordered a meal and never got my fries, also make sure you remember to ask for any sauce as they do not remind you at the window.

text: Fast service and quality food. The workers are very friendly and accommodating. The lines are usually not too long but even when they are, it moves pretty quickly. When I ordered my 2 meals and a sandwich, my food was ready in less than 5 minutes. I was very impressed by how quickly I was served. The chicken sandwiches and waffle fries were delicious as usual. It's always a pleasant experience.

name: Ms. Anderson

name: Kaska Howard
text: Cold biscuits! Who in the world serves cold biscuits???

name: Walter “Roy” Edwards
text: Good food as expected exceptionally good service.  However, had to ask for Chic sauce .

name: Lauren M.
text: I asked for my chicken biscuit to be well done and they told me they don’t do that anymore. I hate when my skin is running off the chicken from lack of being cooked all the way if I saw where I could post a pic I would I don’t see what’s the problem about cooking somebody’s food well done when I’ve always got my chicken biscuit well done and this is the only chick fila I’ve ever had nuggets from that don’t taste or feel fresh and hot after you specifically asked for them to be dropped fresh

name: Christy Davis
text: Can never go wrong with the original chicken sandwich! I love extra pickles on mine!

name: Ginny Mitchell
text: I am a huge Chick-fil-A fan.  The food here is always hot and amazing.  Unfortunately, the last two times we have been here, we have spent 20+ minutes in line.  They try to mainstream the process by having various people take your order outside.  Unfortunately, it still goes slow when getting the food.

name: Brian R. Hampton
text: Always a great experience. Excellent customer service, fast food, hot food

name: Tim Allen
text: Food & Staff were great as usual & had unexpectedly run in to relatives at the restaurant.

name: Paul Romanick
text: Thank You for the 12 days of Christmas rewards. May you and all your employees have a very Blessed Christmas and 2020.

name: Robbie Miles
text: It good chicken

name: Lindsey Scott
text: Love this chick fil a!! They are always so friendly and efficient! I’ve never experienced a problem here! All the staff make you feel right at home and go out of their way to give a good experience! Keep up the great work, you guys are fantastic!!

name: EastCoast Stinnett
text: Review not needed. Always quick, extremely pleasant, and top notch. They are so good, I was annoyed on my last trip that they left off one of my 4 sauces (I always get an unnecessary amount of sauces). That's how on point they are always.

name: Scottie Swindle
text: I’m amazed at how quickly the drive through operates! Polite workers. I have never had a negative experience at Chick-fil-A!

name: Alaina Gray
text: Literally the worst chick fil a I’ve ever visited . My order is always wrong

name: Paul McLain
text: Food is always good but the drive thru is a challenge. Be prepared to wait. If there was more parking it would help.Better to go in.

name: Faraz Anjum
text: I really love daphne chick fill a, I go there a lot more than couple of times a week. There is someone is really rude I reported her one time seem like, after that it has gotten worse since I reported. so I was in line and was the  next person to place my order she was watching me in line and not call me to take my order, other cashier was taking someone else order and when other cashier called me to take my order she called the person who was behind me and took that persons order I did not really care if she called me or not to take my order but after that my next visit I had a pick up inside chick fill a and she is the one who handed me my order, the way she handed me my order was really rude, I can’t really describe in Writhing, I hope someone else takes my order next time I am there if not I think I am gonna be going to Spanish fort chick fill a.

name: zach tolleson
text: Chick fil a does fast food right. The people working there are always friendly and make the customer experience, the food is always hot and there is never a wait for your food. While the menu is limited, they have perfected chicken whether fried or grilled.

name: Randy Lawson
text: Always the best

name: Cynthia Cribbs
text: Awesome 😎

name: Heather R. Houston
text: Fantastic as always!!!  Service & Food Excellent!

name: Sam Shorrosh
text: Always packed, always superior service, very clean, friendly staff, excellent food.

name: Brad Johnson
text: There really should be more places like this! The workers actually put in the effort to make it the best experience possible and the quality of food is some of the best fast food available. Also the playground is a nice bonus if you have kids and the ice cream cone coupons and gift cards are great to give and receive. Also the condiments are the best.

name: Jean Jenkins
text: Drive-thru cars wrapped around the building ... pretty much sums it up! Great food, efficient and courteous crew.

name: Lillie Ray
text: Always excellent

name: erica fultz
text: Yall always nice & I love that you have a reward program in your app.

name: bridget
text: Best staff out of any restaurant out there. Super fast and accurate too.

name: Pamela Burckel
text: This location have  the typical good food, friendly service is a clean place that I visit every time that I pass through Tallahassee, unless it's a Sunday when they're closed.

name: Mike Pancoast
text: Really long line but it didn't take as long as I thought it would.

name: Rhonda W
text: Breakfast was great, I received the wrong item, but they provided the correct item quickly and professionally. Great experience as always.

name: Frank Trotter
text: I gotta' give a shout out to Kenya, who took my order with the biggest smile on her face you could ever see. I had a bowl of spicy deliciousness which is also called their Taco Soup. I mean, it was so good, I wanted to lick the bowl and prolly would have if I wasn't inside the restaurant. BTW, Briggs and Thane were outside doing a great job taking orders in the rain to keep that drive thru moving along but they also took the time to greet me and hold the door open for me. The Daphne Chick-fil-A is such a quality place--great ownership, great team members, and quite honestly there were a bunch of fun people in there tonight and every single one of them also had a smile on their face...but not as big as Kenya's smile was!

name: Donnie Ricketts
text: Always friendly staff. Always good food. Never a problem. Great place to eat.

name: Paul Spencer
text: Typical of all Chic Fila restaurants, the service was awesome!

name: Jessica Torres
text:
I have been going for my lunch break once a week, and the service is excellent. Even though the line is long, their system keeps it moving. The staff is efficient and polite.
Their drive through is confusing. You need to circle the building to get in the line.

name: Sheree “Gigi” Thornton
text: Fast, friendly and I have never been displeased with the quality of the food.

name: Bob Carlen
text:
Ordered a kids meal plus my food and spent 24.00$
My child saw other children with a free ice cream . Went to get one for my child and they refused to give it to her because she had already taken the plastic off of her toy. Not fair as far as I’m concerned! Especially since we had the kids bag and toy in our hand and had been there for at least two hours! I also was never told she could even have the free ice cream and no rules about opening the toy were posted.

name: Scotty Stimpson
text: Excellent Chick Fil A! Great staff and speedy service!

name: Sandra Felsher
text: Took us 25 minutes to get our mobile order..not the service i have come to expect from chick fil a.  However, as we were eating our fresh hot meal , the manager came over, apologized for the wait time and told us he comped our entire meal. That is why i love chick fil a! I have come to rely on  their great service but no one can be perfect all the time and how you handle those bad days makes all the difference!

name: Daniel Retzloff
text: Suspiciously nice and efficient inside this joint.  I mean like maybe they are robots or something.

name: Susan Miles
text:
Easy to get to from the street, but a pain to get out of. There's a road with a light on the north side of Target.
Always clean. Prompt, courteous service. Will bring your food to your table if dining in. And one of the last places that have a play area. Also kept very clean. The food is great, as always.

name: Tabitha M.
text: Normally I’m 100% satisfied with this location (other than the super long lines) which is why I’m giving 3 stars.. but today my chicken sandwich was soggy and fell apart, chicken was in like 3 pieces instead of one patty and had soggy breading, and my fries were not cooked all the way and the drive thru worker seemed annoyed and not pleasant. Thought I was at McDonald’s for a sec

name: Allen Hollis
text: Excellent service as expected, amazing staff and great food.

name: Dianna McClure
text: It is sort of tricky to maneuver into the drive thru at this Chick-fil-A. Then there is no screen to look at. A hostess politely takes your order but I am not familiar with the menu so I had to request one. The service was fast and food was hot..order was correct.

name: Karen Peacock
text: Hey, it's Chick-fil-A...   No more needs to be said.   Food is delicious and employees are the best!   Even if there's a long line in the drive-thru, it still doesn't take long!   They do an A+ job!!

name: Kimberly Griffin
text: Seemed very detached tonight. Got my drink wrong and that's my favorite part..then my fries  were half full. Not the best visit visit

name: Peter Rambacher
text: Best customer service and most friendly staff of any fast food restaurant.

name: Rachel Phillips
text: This restaurant is very clean and orderly, the staff is always in a good mood, greeting you with a smile and leaving you with a "My Pleasure".  The bathrooms are clean, the food is delicious and the atmosphere of being here keeps you wanting to come back over and over again.  GREAT Family Place to Eat!

name: Leonard Dinsmore
text: Very quick and efficient getting what you order.

If you want GREAT service and food like you expect go to Chic Fil A in Spanish Fort on HWY 181. WELL worth the drive.

text: Ordered a # 1 as always in the drive thru, No way to check your order as they are pushing you through the line. Got back to my office & had 3 sandwiches. I REALLY WANTED MY WAFFLE FRIES ! Never had my order wrong before , guess that there is a first time for everything.

name: Regina Stanton
text: My son loves it here and he refuses to eat chicken nuggets unless they are from chic-fil-a! 😄 my food is always hot and fresh.  The play are gives incentive for my son to eat all his food then he plays while I get to enjoy my food. Win-win 😁 always clean. And impeccable service

name: Ari
text: I have a very hit or miss experience with Chick-Fil-A as of late. I've been shorted food, been given medium drinks when I pay for large, but occasionally I get amazing service with no problems. So it depends on when you go I suppose.

name: Sunny Cooper
text: It's a great place family friendly

name: Amber Turrentine
text:
I have never seen a Chick-fil-A  so unorganized and rude. We have been there a few times and generally get met with service that is mediocre at best. None of the employees ever look happy or offer that great customer service Chick-fil-A  is known for.

Today was beyond frustrating and caused me to be late for work. I placed a pick up order and at 12:24. At 12:33 I recieved the notification that my food was ready. At 12:41 my food still wasn't  ready. The employees were not wanting to help. Finally one asked me to provide my receipt. Turns out that my food was on the counter the entire time and it was cold by the time I got it at 12:47.

name: Favor Favor
text: This chic fila location has gone down in service. Must’ve hired new management and workers. The Food is cold at times. Fries were undercooked last time I went. They are Not as friendly as the other Chic fila locations. I May as well go mcdonalds somewhere.  Out of the last 5 times I’ve ordered at the Daphne location, there has been something wrong with my food. They need to get it together. There are several other people complaining about this location as well. Chic Fila is the only fast restaurant I’ll eat at, but I’ve finally decided not to order anything from this location anymore. I go out of my way now to go to the or Spanish Fort or Foley location...

name: Kimberly Zimmerman
text: This is my first time in the restaurant. It's crazy busy @1PM. The decor is nice with fresh flowers on all of the tables. The employees have been very attentive. My food came out fast. There were plenty of tables to sit at even though it is so busy. So glad I came in! Oh and the new market salad is amazing!

- J.K

name: Zach Taylor
text: Bad experience I always choose curbside delivery and I ordered my wife a chicken meal and when I arrived home to give her biscuit meal. The chicken was extremely small and burned and soon as she took a bite immediately said she didn’t want it anymore. We order from y’all every week often and to spend money on a biscuit meal have it burned and very small piece of chicken is not good at all. I don’t know who would want to eat and small piece of chicken that is burned. Whoever prepared this meal did not seem to care about the customers at all. The nearest chick fla is in mobile that I know of and I’m really thinking about taking my business. Only good thing about the meal was the sweet tea and the hash browns. Biscuit was terrible!! 11/28/2017

name: Leif VanHorn
text: I just went to chic fil a on 98 at daphne today. The experience was amazing. It was supposedly  "cow day." Every one wore spotted shirts and got discounts. There were families and children,  happy, all around, yet there still enough room for me to dine in yet this was meant to be more of a smaller drive through store.  I had my food within five minutes. Unlike a lot of restaurants the credit card swipe machine worked fast and smoothly. My food tasted great. A manager even sat down and interviewed me with my experience (I ate in). I had a iced coffee and it was surprisingly tasty. The servers were very generous happy, friendly,  and giggling while maintaining a serious working mentality. I recommend this to anyone coming to this chic fil a location. - Leif

The only thing to be aware of is that there are students from a local school who often come here during lunch, so it may be extra busy from time to time.

name: Steven Bradley
text:
Edit: One of the worst experiences this trip. Slowest service ever at any CFA. After we received our order (it had an error), I had to walk back up to the register where I was ignored by several staff members, and a manager who walked by multiple times.

The "chick-fil-a app" is pure garbage. It crashes constantly while trying to place an order. After finally getting an order placed, it showed ready for pick up. The staff had no clue how to fulfill the order. I had to wait for a manager to look at my phone, and he hesitantly filled the order.

Previous visit: Fast, polite, and great food!

Also, one of the few fast food chains that still has a play area!

My kids always pick Chick-fil-A.

text: It usually seems chaotic inside and outside the building, although the employees are nice. It's fast food, so I don't really feel the need to explain the quality of the food, but if you're in need of a quick protein meal I would choose here over most places. Price is average for what you get. They REALLY need to fix the drive-thru situation, though. Their drive-thru lines block traffic for Target customers and people trying to navigate on Hwy 98. Which, really, is more-so an issue with the level of ignorance and self-centeredness of their customers who willingly block traffic just to use the drive-thru, when there are myriad parking spaces available...but I digress.

text: I just had an experience that I've never had before at a Chick-fil-A. I pulled up to the restaurant at 6:05 and my food was not handed to me until 6:40. I waited in the drive thru line for 5 minutes that was at standstill and then I decided to go inside.  The two cashiers had a dazed look on their face as they slowly waited on customers which took 10 minutes and then I stood there waiting on my food for another 20 minutes. mind you that it was dinner time and the server told me that the holdup was that they were waiting on the two Chick-fil-A sandwiches. Entertainment that I had during this whole weight was watching the employees slowly sonder back and forth behind the counter.

name: ASwedishPig
text:
First time to this location. Was passing through for work and noticed the Buffet sign. So I decided to help myself to that.

The place was clean and welcoming which was a surprise. Though the floors were traditional fast food slippery, but what can you do. The buffet was about 10$ a head. That was after we added a small drink.

I was actually surprised be the addition of a few items that well in the south should be on any Soul Food Buffet. Like Yams, collard greens, cabbage, Lima beans and a few other. So that was a plus.

Over all, everything was fresh and hot. I got what I wanted and I enjoyed the experience. As far as the whole trip it was good for the one time event. I can't say that I enjoyed the KFC enough to constantly have a buffet visit or that 10 could really be worth the plates I ate. However I was on a 30min time frame. So if I felt like being lazy and getting all my dollars outta that I'm sure i could have.

This was a good stop none the less. Give it a try.

text: Love their food

name: 莫笑西风
text: Food's okay, but the service was horrible, we've ordered 8 piece meal received only 6 and a super tiny one, smaller than chicken nuggets. We ordered a mashed potato with gravy but they give us mash potato without gravy. I also ordered a popcorn chicken box, we went to the store twice and still didn't receive it, they insist they gave us the food already but that's not true. And the cup holder its soft AF, one drink dropped directly right after I left all over my car.

name: Tricia DeLeonardis
text:
Corie , the manager was the ultimate employee, going above and beyond our expectations!! He was working so fast and thoroughly that I knew he must be the manager!  I asked if he was and he said yes! I told him " YOU ROCK"  . He deserves to be appreciated more ! He should own the place! The Colonel would be proud!!
Thanks again,  Corie!!!!!
From The lady trucker and man at Wiley Sanders!! We Will be back!

They used the chicken that was on the buffet to fulfill other orders and then told the people that purchased the buffet that it would be at least twenty minutes before any more chicken was out. That item is literally in the name!  Service was rough, any time you asked for anything is was as if you were inconveniencing them.

Then the registers inside worked fine with a card , so why could they have not stepped over as there were no other inside customers in line . I will say they were very accomodating with my order and the mix of chicken I wanted so that's why I raised it to a 3 star else it would've been a 2.

text: I so love KFC. I have since I was a child.  It is comfort food to me.  I enjoy getting their pot pies for lunch. The quality of food hasn't changed at all. The KFC on 72 East is a really nice dining room.  The KFC in Guntersville has an incredible buffet.

name: Thomas Stoll
text: We stopped in on the road with four people we ordered the buffet. The entire time sitting and eating chicken was slow coming out there was no coleslaw the potato salad looks runny and very little in the dish. The lack of replenishment on the buffet bar was extremely slow and we were disgusted and just left

name: Greg Sawka
text: They're closed they don't know how to operate a business.... Can't go inside so  Midas will be closed

name: Brennan Hydrick
text:
Rule #1 of running a business, if a customer is begging you to take their money, you sell them the product!!

Rule #2 of running a business.  If you hire employees to work, your expectations was probably for them to work.  Not sit around on their phones ignoring customers.

Went to this location tonight for the KFC buffet due to it being quick and easy and we were on a time crunch.  Walked in, buffet looked great, fully stocked and not another customer in the restaurant.  Walked up to the register and ordered the buffet.  Was told they couldn’t sell it because it’s suppose to be taken down at 8p.  Seeing that it was 740p I asked politely if I could order it and will be finished eating by 8.   I was told no.

I asked again and was told no.  I was the only customer you had in the entire building, trying to purchase a product that the employees don’t even have to prepare.  Take my money!!!

I told the cashier thanks and walked out to a local business that ended up being really good.  I was so confused about a business not wanting to sell their product, I went back to the KFC at 830 because I knew that buffet would still be set up and not sold.  Yes, there it was, employees not working and playing on their phones and product not being sold.

name: J Davenport
text: I will say the best part of our experience was being served by Michael.  He is the most pleasant employee ever at Troy.  I watched as he waited on one person after another with a smile and exceptional service.

And u have to purchase the buffet to get anything off of it. Which is wonderful cause me and my family love choices. Great job guys on the change you guys are going thru. GOD works miracles on his anointed

name: Jason Lee
text:
I dread coming to this location. I avoid it like the plague. Until I go out of town and am reminded how good KFC is.  Then I make another attempt to enjoy it locally. And every single time I leave furious.

Don't get me wrong, the food is good, but the staff....
I have been argued with at the buffet about whether or not the mashed potatoes were old (they were).
I have been lied to about being out of tenders only to watch the next customer get some.
And I've actually been threatened by someone operating the drive thru. (He glared at me the whole time I was receiving my order and literally jumped towards me as if to take a swing as I drove away) I almost stopped the car to have a little chat, but had my kids and thought better of it.
Not to mention all of the just general hostile/disgusted nature of everyone working there.

Bottom line, until someone I know and trust assures me that the whole staff/management has been replaced, I won't go back and I will continue to talk trash Everytime I drive by. Call me petty.

We had to wait on our order bc wedges were cooking, but all we got we 2 chicken littles a piece and they even frigged that up and gave us the wrong flavors, and grease was soaked through our bag from the sandwiches. Never again, lesson learned. Just be smart and go to a place that's not a 3 star rating.

name: Danny Smith
text: Not a fived-star restaurant, but pretty much as good as it gets for fast food. The place was clean, the employees neat and made an honest effort to be helpful, and an unexpected bonus: this KFC had a buffet, the first KFC buffet I have encountered. No more having to choose between sides or entrees, you can have a little bit of all your favorites, plus bananna pudding or some Oreo concotion for dessert. I don't know wshat it was called, but the Oreo stuff was really good, and I don't even like Oreo's. I have loved KFC since I was a kid, and was very disappointed when our KFC closed some 8 or 10 years ago, but any time I am out of town, I try to eat at a restaurant we don't have back at home, and if the KFC buffet is something that lasts, it will be my first choice on the road. Now, who do I see about getting OUR KFC back?

I have lived in Troy over 18 years and the 4 times I have been in there, they screw up the damn order.

text: I don't normally leave bad reviews but the customer service was terrible. Waited for 8 minutes at the checkout for someone to take our order. We were the only people there besides a few people already eating and one car in the drive thru. There were five people behind the counter. Two were talking by a freezer even though they saw us. One was stirring the food in the buffet and also saw us. Another girl was just waiting for the kitchen to finish cooking the food. Another guy was just walking around. I have worked fast food so I don't have unrealistic expectations out of fast food workers and this was ridiculous. After a couple minutes we said excuse me we'd like to order. The two gossiping by the fridge ignored us and continued talking. Will never go to this KFC again. We left and got Popeyes instead.

They asked me what side I wanted and I told them mashed potatoes and honey mustard dipping sauce.  I had to wait for the tenders to be cooked which was ok with me but when I got home and opened the box I had cole slaw instead of potatoes, I don't eat cole slaw.  There was no dipping sauce or biscuit either.  I don't understand how you can get a standard box meal wrong.

text: Good, but.... what do they have against veggies?  I was so disappointed after my food was delivered last night that I almost left a horrible review. Normally I order my phillies with extra, but  there was no option for special requests.  Also, it was not disclosed that the salads came with pickles (chopped into tiny pieces?!?). Not necessarily gross, but what an unpleasant surprise! But I was famished and ate it anyway. Oh, and the rattle in my cup of diet Coke with no ice (which actually was an option) .....

name: D M
text: I've given this cookout a chance on 3 separate occasions. I never leave negative google reviews but at this point I feel obligated to. On my first 2 visits to this cookout they manage to completely mess up both of my orders. On my 3rd visit I sat in the outside lane waiting to order but no one answered me through the speaker. I then pulled up to the window and asked if the outside lane speaker works and the employee told me no it did not. I asked why was there no sign on the speaker indicating this or why was the lane not blocked off. At this point there was already a line of cars waiting behind me attempting to order in the outside Lane. The worker then had the audacity to ask me if I would personally go tell the other cars waiting behind me that they would have to pull into the inside lane if they wanted to order. After all of that they did not let me place an order at the window and then told me I would have to drive around and get back in the one functioning lane. I promptly said no thank you and left. Honestly, if I could give this place negative 5 stars I would. It's a shame one of the only 2 cookouts in the area probably has the worst customer service I've ever seen in my life.

PRO tip: If your getting a quesadilla, get 2 because they are small.

text: Burger,  Quality ingredients, good thick meat patty, great price, built my way.   Will go back.

name: Daisy Lawrence
text: I gave 4 stars because you can't five 3.5. stars. They had wonderful customer service , was very accurate on order & very accommodating. Since being in business in our area for about 4 months, customer service & attitudes are awful. Food is great & very reasonably priced.

name: Bradley Gilbert
text:
God, where do i even begin.
First up, the "lady" taking our order in the drive-thru started asking for our order before we even pulled up all the way. I tried to yell out the window that we weren't even at the board yet because the person in front of us was not pulled up far enough. When we did finally get to the board she would ask if we were ready to order LITERALLY every 4 seconds.
Next, since it was our first time there (AND LAST) the order board was like reading hieroglyphics. there were so many things on the menu and none of them were set up in a way to where they made sense. The 2 Order takers took turns asking over and over and over again what our order was.
I did not get what I wanted and honestly I don't know what i wanted because I couldn't understand the order board while being berated by two order takers, rushing us through.
3rd... When we did get to the window to pay, the cashier was rude and cold and shoved our order at us without saying a word. I would have been offended but I could see on her face that she has a permanent attitude and will likely be nothing more than a cashier, ever. If she worked for me she would not even last 1 hour... And she would be gone with her nasty attitude and Lee Press-On Nails that were sharpened into long claws. Also, if you're going to hire someone that is the face of your business, choose one that has a smile on it.
4th....the  Hamburger was a bland. Boring. Forgetful. The cajun fries were cheap dime store crinkle cut Frozen "french fries", if you could call them that with a straight face.
The Banana Pudding milkshake was pretty damn good. Not the best I've ever had, but pretty damn good..... The "service" at this location, is pretty damn bad. We won't be back.

name: David Dees
text: I would give Cook Out 3.5 stars.  It gets credit for how fast and efficient they move the drive thru.  The customer service was good, even saying “my pleasure” like Chik Fil A.  I didn’t know what to expect from Cook Out.  In my mind I thought maybe it was a quality fast food burger, that cost more than an average fast food burger.  What I found was a cheaper than expected menu with good prices but the food is also just very average, nothing special, average quality.  The milkshakes are nothing special. Dairy Queen and Sonic have much better milkshakes and I would say Burger King has a better burger.  It’s ok and will eat there some as it’s convenient but not somewhere I would recommend as a regular spot.  The portions are on the smaller end as well.

Been eating cookout for a few years now and still wondering how we can eat so much for so less! Great food at incredibly low prices... what more do you want?
Their new Chorizo Quesadilla is amazing and the Cheese bites are just perfect.

name: Hewy NoSleep
text:
We tried it out for the first time today around 2pm. It had two thru lanes and both were full. It took around  8 minutes from the start  of the line until we got the food but wait was mainly due to people reading there very big menu and not due to waiting on food.

I did love the choices of options. I would recommend you view their menu online and decide what you want before you get there because you could become overwhelmed by choices if you see it for the first time.

We spent around 7 dollars each.  I got a drink, burger and dog. The other order was a chicken sandwich, slaw, onion rings and drink. The chicken patty was small and flat compared to other fast food. The slaw was in a small sauce cup and she only received three breaded onion rings. She said the taste was good but the potions small. My burger & dog were ballpark field quality in a good way. The taste was great and they were the perfect size. I also loved being able to customize what I wanted on both.

I saw they had a walk up window for orders as well in case you didn't want to wait in the drive thru line. I think if you want a chicken sandwich you may want to go somewhere that focuses on it but if you have people who want different things from Corndogs to BBQ to Shakes then this is the perfect one stop place to make everyone happy.

text: Food is exceptional prices are great

text: I have eaten at the one in Hattiesburg and the one in Tuscaloosa. Both were great. The one here in Birmingham does NOT measure up. I was in line for 50 minutes. That is not a typo. 50 minutes. I wanted to leave the line, but I was in the inside lane so I was trapped. By the time I finally got my food, the fries were completely cold. Fries should be the last thing that go in the bag, right before you give it to the guest. I guess they put them in there when I placed my order.  Terrible experience. Birmingham has a lot of places to eat. If Cook Out does not DRASTICALLY improve, it will be gone soon. Would give it zero stars if I could.

name: Joey Amberson
text: Glad Birmingham finally has a Cook Out.  I've been several times since opening on New Year's Day and the service has always been pretty quick considering the number of customers in line.  Only downside is the staff needs to be trained better with how much change to give back if paying with cash.  Paid with a $50 on one occasion for a $14 meal and only got back $6 in change and another time I could tell the worker at the window had no clue how much change to give back after paying for a $11 meal with a $20.

name: Brendan Borders
text:
For some reason, the service here is extremely slow. I've never seen anything like it. If you pull in at 5, you definitely aren't leaving the drive thru line till 530. The only reason why I give 2 stars instead of 1, is because the employees seem apologetic at the window.

I'm not one to complain, but MGMT needs to step in and figure out the problems with the drive thru, because at this point, its not fast food anymore.

text: Always delicious! The food is prepared wonderfully and their milkshakes speak for themselves!! 10/10 would recommend.

name: Robbert Fairbrother
text: This place has good cheap eat almost stays opened twenty four hours and is always a lot of folks grabbing a bite to eat. However the star of the show in my opinion is their shakes. They have over forty shakes but my favorite it oreo mint and the egg nog shake. Thick using quality ingredients makes this the best shake in the area. What I really enjoy about this place is the service is fast and they even have two drive thru's. Always worth a return visit.

name: Darcy Moseley
text: I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, no pickles, with the rest of the works, fries, onion rings, coke. I liked everything except the fries. I'd rather have seasoned  crinkled fries. The taste of the regular fries was not tasty nor done all the way. The rest of the food was very hot and delicious.  The food stayed hot in the foil until I got home to Irondale. I loved how my burger was wrapped in foil not paper or a cardboard box, Like McDonald's. The lines were super long, got my order within 10 minutes after getting there. Those double lines are perfect in getting customers our food quickly.  I'm continuing going there. I hope one opens up in Birmingham so I don't have to go on a road trip to get my food. I  have NEVER heard of Cook Out Restaurant,  only the movie Cook Out with Rapper Eve. Didn't know it have a walk up window and the parking lot is super small.  When you build new eateries you know PEOPLE love to eat. Make the parking lot a lot bigger.

name: Mollie Kimbrough
text: If you have a large family or a college student and you need to eat good however your pockets low. This place is where you want to be. I have a large family and so I'm used to paying a large bill for us to have good food. This place actually made my mouth drop after getting the bill for my family; super low loved it.  Now the food was really good too; major plus. So just saying my family and I will be there very often.

name: Alexander Hubbard
text: For what I paid, I received more than I expected.

name: kelly pender
text: Good food and not expensive. Huge list of milkshake flavors and fresh fruit available  as mix ins. Try the fresh banana shake!

name: Christopher Pass
text: Pretty good and fast

name: Jourdynn Butler
text: Burgers are amazing and fresh

name: Chris Saulter
text: Best milkshakes in town

name: Kenneth Johnson
text: Inexpensive  and fast.

name: Forrest Chambers
text: Cook Out is a must try for some of the best fast food around town. Their large menu has something for everyone and the value of their combo meal cannot be beat as it comes with two sides. The staff has been nothing short of outstanding since the grand opening. They have been very pleasant and efficient every time I’ve visited. They might give Chick Fil A some much needed competition with their customer service.

name: Vince Krista
text: It's a quick meal that's tastes good even late

name: CantBeAfraid ToTry
text: My first time.  Love m drive thru always wrapped around the building but the walk up service was a 8 min wait.  This was during 12-1 lunch hour.  I was impressed.  Now there's so much to choose from.  The burger n bacon wrap is too good.  The shake is very thick it's more like icecream.  Try it and put your own lunch together.

name: Mary Jane Davis
text: Good quick made to order food. Nothing fancy but is tasty. Friendly service. Liked their fry sauce!

name: Steven Smith
text: Food is good and prices are good. Staff is friendly. My only complaint is food could be more fresh. Fries could be hot. Other than that, glad you are in Birmingham.

name: Lori Gould
text: My chicken sandwich was a bit disappointing,  but the burgers others ordered looked good.

name: Ryan Watson
text: The parking lot was very small and it was almost impossible to find a park during lunch. There was also a wait inside to get a table. The food was overall pretty good, but the portions of the side items was very small. Overall a decent experience, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.

text: The food is cheap and the food tastes ok. I like that I can walk up to the window to place an order, which I prefer since the inside is so crowded. The service was pretty fast though. I enjoyed my hamburger, but the fries were too salty. They forgot to give us condiments, but no big deal. It’s nothing special. The lines are long, but probably because they just opened not too long ago. The customer service was fantastic though, and I hope they keep that part up. I will most likely go back.

text: Everything is good. But just so slow even there are two service window . Especially lunch time 12-2pm. Staff are always friendly.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Very pleased. Terrific, friendly, and fast service. Pricing is quite reasonable. I really like Cheerwine and you never see it on menus but it is here!  Burger was very good. When I unwrapped it from the foil, it looked like the picture. Cheese covered completely both patties but none was stuck on the wrapper as it would have been anywhere else. The onion slices were fresh and cut thickly. The pickles were delightful. They were rectangular had a great flavor and were not soggy — they had a nice little crunch to them. But the tomato!  It was so big that it also covered the whole sandwich and was clearly cut fresh.  I hope they always buy big tomatoes and that this is the way they always are. Fries and onion rings were both good. Hush puppies were not what we are used to in the South. Not bad but I won’t order again.  Plenty of them in the bag.  They were the size — and looked like — a cocktail weenie that had been battered and fried.  The result is a large surface area that is hard and barely any fluffy corn meal inside. I do highly recommend going here — especially when hungry late. I will certainly be back very soon!

text: Place was a joke. No tables to sit and eat but c'mon in. Drive thru was at a snails pace. We went in and stood there with 4 other groups for over 10 minutes. No one even acknowledged us standing there. Got fed up and left. Dont waste your time.
